position: Exciting PR Internship with Sports AI Startup - Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description

Sparrow is an early-stage startup that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help athletes improve.

We are offering a valuable Public Relations & Business Marketing Spring internship for a bright, motivated, resourceful college student or recent college graduate looking to learn the ins and outs of the startup, A.I., and sports worlds.

You’ll work closely with the company’s serial-entrepreneur CEO & core business marketing team to strategize and execute the 2021 Agenda and related Public Relations, including:

  • Sparrow's App Store Launch
  • Sparrow's upcoming Equity Crowdfunding Campaign
  • Email Marketing Campaigns
  • Social Media Presence
  • Public Relations
  • Influencer Outreach
  • And much more!

Person sought must:

  • Be a student at or a recent graduate of a reputable 4-year college, with either a business, communications or marketing related degree and/or experience
  • Be able to work an 8 hour work day (-40 hours per week) end of May through end of August 2021 or longer
  • Be uber-productive, able to switch between different kinds of tasks, and comfortable taking on all jobs complex or mundane.
  • Be experienced and comfortable using online tools like G Suite, email marketing platforms and social media outlets like Youtube, Instagram, and Twitter.
  • Be very detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative
  • Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools
  • Be someone excited to learn
  • Be able to outreach to other companies and professionals

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

  • Work closely with the company founders, successful serial entrepreneurs who have started numerous companies, raised over $20 million in venture capital for them, and have 2 successful exits. (check out our founders here: https://youtu.be/r82gufgzltg)
  • Gain Experience in the PR and Business Marketing Fields
  • Learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started
  • Receive a $50 weekly stipend, college credit and potentially earn an equity bonus (stock options), and more importantly gain relationships in the tech, AI, and sports industry

Testimonials from Sparrow’s Intern Classes

* My time at Sparrow has been great! I’ve learned the ins and outs of what it takes to successfully run a business + gained valuable insight from the founders. -Gabriel R., Yale University (Men’s Varsity Golf, Econ)

* I was given real responsibilities while working alongside people who really exemplified what it means to be a part of a team. - Georgia L., Williams College (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Psych Major)

*I definitely feel as though I’m honing important skills and experience for when I enter the job market.” said the rising senior. - Abby E., Pomona College in CA (Women’s Varsity Golf, Psych Major)

*At Sparrow I assisted with fundraising rounds, analyzing consumer/user data & conceptualizing macro marketing schemes - experiences that will help me for years to come. - Nick S., USC (Business Major)

* I loved getting exposure into the fast paced start-up world - my internship with Sparrow was awesome!

- Rebecca R., Brown University (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Applied Math major)

* Interning at Sparrow was so valuable! I got to work with the founders and see first hand how a successful company is made! - Annie M, Lehigh (Womens’ Varsity Lacrosse, Business Major)

* My internship with Sparrow was great! I worked on an investment and PR project that contributed to the launch of the company. - Colette M., Columbia University (Women's Varsity Soccer)

** My internship with Sparrow was a valuable one. I worked closely with the co-founders & gained valuable insight into the inner workings of a great startup. - Adam X., Harvard University (Men’s Varsity Golf)

* I worked with an expert machine learning advisor, got my name on a patent and had an all around amazing experience with Sparrow! Trevor J., University of Michigan (Computer Science Major)

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $50.00 per week

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

  • Social media management: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Public relations: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Full Job Description

Kodiak was founded in April 2018 to develop autonomous technology that carries freight forward—so people, partners, and the planet thrive. Navigating highway environments presents vastly different challenges than urban streets. Kodiak’s experienced team has developed the industry’s most advanced technology stack purpose-built specifically for long-haul trucks. From our sensor fusion system that maximizes the value of every sensing modality, to our unique lightweight mapping solution that allows our trucks to navigate ever-changing highway construction zones, our world-class team of industry pioneers is bringing the benefits of autonomy to the $800B a year trucking industry quickly, safely, and efficiently.

We are looking for Interns in various areas of our software stack. Our ideal candidates exhibit a can-do attitude and approach their work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.

We are looking for Interns who:

  • Are excited to work on autonomous trucks that are running in the real world. Your work will help advance the state-of-the-art autonomous trucking platform.
  • Are looking to develop their coding skills on a production-level codebase. You should be comfortable reading and writing modern C++ code.
  • Look forward to collaborating with other engineers on a day-to-day basis.
  • Are motivated by challenging problems without clear-cut solutions.

Additional skills that will help you be successful at Kodiak:

  • Comfort with fundamental mathematics, linear algebra and calculus.
  • Knowledge of the current state of robotics and/or self-driving.
  • Knowledge of modern revision tracking systems (e.g. git).

Education requirement:

  • Field(s) of study: Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Automotive Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or other related fields.
  • Will consider graduate students at any stage of their Masters or Ph.D. studies.

Program timing:

  • Start Date: we are flexible, but the sooner the better.
  • Our internship program is 12-16 weeks; end date is flexible based on individual needs.

Other:

  • Location: Mountain View, CAFull time (40 hours per week)
  • Compensations: competitive base pay with health benefits
  • Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation to/in the local area.

At Kodiak, we strive to build a diverse community working towards our common company goals in a safe and collaborative environment where harassment of any kind is strictly prohibited. Kodiak is committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

Job Type: Internship

position: Intern, Electronic Control Unit (ECU) Diagnostics Test Engineer, Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description
Leading the future of luxury mobility
Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.
We are currently seeking an Intern, Electronic Control Unit (ECU) Diagnostics Test Engineer. This position requires an experienced professional with experience writing with a scripting language such as Python for testing, and an interest in automotive diagnostics. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment. Role/Responsibilities:
Learn automotive diagnostics if necessary
Performing Electronic Control Unit (ECU) diagnostics testing with existing tools and bucks (VR)
Maintain Vspy function blocks and Python scripts according to Electronic Control Unit (ECU) Candela Document (CDDs)
Test on bucks or cars to read Data Identifier (DIDs), Diagnostic Trouble Code (DTCs) from Electronic Control Units (ECUs)
Compare the actual values from Electronic Control Unit (ECU) with requirements

Document scripts and test reports Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in Python 3 or C++ scripting languages
Skilled in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Knowledge of electronics fundamentals

Familiar with computer networks Nice to Haves:
Familiar with embedded systems and Linux
Familiar with automotive diagnostics: UDS (ISO14229-1), DoIP(ISO13400-2) Education:
Field(s) of study: Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Related Major
Will consider undergrads Junior level or above: Pursuing Bachelor’s or master’s degree
Graduated are eligible for this internship up to 12 months after graduation Programming Timing:
Start Date: September 7th, 2021
End Date: November 26th- December 23rd
Our internship program is 12-16 weeks; end date is flexible based on individual needs
Some flexibility with start date is available as needed Other:
Location: This position is in Newark, CA. You must be prepared to start onsite for your first day of employment
Availability: Full – Time is preferred
Anticipated Hours: 8:30am – 5:30pm
Work Environment: Mix - Split between: Office/ Lab/ Bay
Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable.
Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization.
Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week.
Housing: No compensation for housing.
Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses.
Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence.
Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area.
Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check.
Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department. Be part of something amazing
Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.
At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.
To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

company: Center For Strategic And International Studies -
description:
Full Job Description

The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) is a non-profit, bipartisan public policy organization established in 1962 to provide strategic insights and practical policy solutions to decision makers concerned with global security and prosperity. Over the years, it has grown to be one of the largest organizations of its kind, with a staff of some 200 employees, including more than 120 analysts working to address the changing dynamics of international security across the globe.
JOB SUMMARY:
CSIS is seeking a full-time research intern from July 2021 to December 2021 to support the CSIS Reconnecting Asia Project–an initiative that analyses the evolving digital, transport, and energy connectivity of Eurasia, including China’s Belt and Road Initiative. The team’s research has been featured in outlets such as the Financial Times, the Economist, and National Geographic. The position is research and data entry intensive and therefore requires excellent time management skills and careful attention to detail. Candidates should function well in a fast-paced team environment, adapt quickly to a wide variety of research and analytical tasks, and have strong written and oral communications skills. Team members will have regular opportunities to contribute research, input, and ideas for analytical pieces. Our interns have used their experience at CSIS to win prestigious scholarships, enter top graduate schools, and secure full-time positions in the public and private sectors. Applicants must be able to commit to full-time availability for the full internship period to be considered.
Candidates with the following skills and experience are highly desired and encouraged to apply:

  • Previous research or data collection experience related to China’s Belt and Road Initiative.
  • Familiarity with digital infrastructure and digital connectivity (5G, smart cities, fiberoptic cables, data centers, etc.) including its physical components, economic and policy implications, and strategic risks.
  • The ability to research proficiently in Chinese and perform some translation.
  • Data Analysis skills including advanced Excel functions (e.g., pivot tables and formulas), regressions, or other trend analysis using R or Python.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Essential functions may include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Conduct research and data entry tasks related to infrastructure and connectivity development.
  • Compile daily newsletters and manage Reconnecting Asia social media outlets.
  • Contribute to analytical products through research, ideas, and general awareness of relevant news, publications, and international events.
  • Assist with the online publication processes for news and analysis updates.
  • Various other research and logistical tasks as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE, EDUCATION, AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Candidates must have strong English-language writing and research skills, be effective critical thinkers, and have strong attention to detail.
  • Practical and/or academic background in at least one of the following areas is desirable:
  • International Relations
  • Regional Studies (specific to Asia)
  • Economics
  • Information Technology
  • Data or Computer Science

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORK CONDITIONS:
The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee working in an office environment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.
HOW TO APPLY:
Interested applicants must submit a resume, cover letter, short writing sample, and a GIS sample (required for GIS applicants only) at https://csiscareers.silkroad.com. For more information on the Reconnecting Asia Project, please visit: https://reconnectingasia.csis.org.
Letters of recommendation can be sent to Ms. Maesea McCalpin at mmccalpin@csis.org

Required Skills

Required Experience

Job Type: Internship

Full Job Description
JOB SUMMARY: The Dallas Stars are seeking an intern to join our growing Business Intelligence department. The Business Intelligence Intern will mainly support initiatives in the Ticket Sales & Service, Sponsorship, and Marketing departments. We are looking for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit who is dependable and not afraid of a challenge. The position will have a direct hand in helping influence Dallas Stars’ ability to organize, analyze, and act on current and future data to keep the business on the cutting edge.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Support business intelligence, ticketing / pricing, marketing, and strategic projects.
Build and present data visualizations, dashboards, and presentations for use across the business.
Review / update current reporting dashboards in Tableau and the SQL queries that support them.
Automate existing processes to empower business units to conduct analyses.
Assist with organizing, cleaning, and managing leads and other data in our Microsoft Dynamics CRM.
Support the creation and analysis of fan and season ticket member surveys.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Continue to advance Stars analytical capabilities and identify new revenue-generating and/or fan-creating opportunities.
Collaborate with Sponsorship and Marketing departments to analyze current market for the Dallas Stars.
Conduct independent research on specific business topics and emerging technological areas.
Evaluate current technological infrastructure and identify areas where technology could be enhanced, added, or replaced to create efficiencies.
Identify potential data sources to integrate into data warehouse / data lake.
Participate in communication with software vendor(s) / third parties frequently as well as evaluate potential new vendors.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
Currently pursuing or recently finished a Bachelor or Master’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Sports Analytics, or related field
Proficient in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint)
Familiarity with data visualization, CRM, and data warehousing tools and concepts
While this position is not required to attend games, it may occasionally require working long/odd hours including weekends and holidays.
0-1 years of analytics experience (or related internships), preferably within a sports organization
Experience with data visualization (Tableau, Tableau Server, Looker, PowerBI) preferred
Experience with data warehouses, queries, and ETL tools (SSMS, SQL, Alteryx, KNIME) preferred
Experience with CRM (Microsoft Dynamics, Salesforce, KORE Software) preferred
Experience with data science and statistical software (R, Python, SAS)
Experience with Ticketmaster/Archtics

Physical Demands and Working Environment
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand, walk, sit, use hands and fingers, handle objects and office tools, reach, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, talk, and hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. The employee is exposed to an office environment, with noise levels usually moderate.

  • This job description does not contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities. Other tasks and duties may be assigned as needed.
DSE Hockey Club, L.P. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Full Job Description
About Us:
Headquartered in beautiful Santa Barbara, HG Insights is the global leader in technology intelligence. HG Insights uses advanced data science methodologies to help the world's largest technology firms and the fastest growing companies accelerate their sales, marketing, and strategy efforts.

We offer a competitive salary, growth potential, and a casual yet professional environment. Get your sweat on at one of our fitness classes or go for a run along the beach which is two blocks away. You can find employees riding bikes to lunch in the funk zone or hanging out in one of our collaboration spaces. We are passionate about our jobs with a get-it-done attitude, yet we don't take ourselves too seriously. While we work very hard, we also enjoy all that the Santa Barbara coast has to offer.

What You'll Do:
HG Insights is experiencing significant growth and in need of a Data Analyst Intern to work directly with our customers on their utilization of our data solutions. This role will challenge you to think creatively and ask questions about data leading to better solutions for our customers and enhancements to our internal processes that create the data. We're looking for someone who is passionate about data and can analyze and translate technical concepts to a sales and marketing audience.

This is an excellent opportunity for a recent grad or rising junior or senior college student to gain hands-on experience with all facets of Data in a supportive small business environment.

This is a paid internship opportunity for someone who wants 'on the job' experience and/or a future career as a Data Analyst and can ideally make a commitment of at least three months. Our Data Analyst Intern would be required to work two- three days per week, with flexible scheduling for current students to help work around academic commitments. Come work in our fast-paced, yet super supportive environment where all ideas are welcome!

What You'll Be Responsible For:
Perform triage, root cause analysis, and corrections to data issues reported by customers or exception reports.

Support the sales and Customer Success teams' data requests.

Explain best practices associated with HG Insights points to customers via Email and phone.

Prep and Deliver data to customers.

Become a resident expert on HG Insights's data sets, products, and markets - including Big Data, Data-as-a-Service, Predictive and Analytical Markets.

Explore additional ways in which HG can activate data sets for customers.

What You'll Need:
SQL Experience

Proficient in Excel - Vlookups, Pivot Tables

Experience with a BI tool like Tableau desired

Excellent listener and problem solver capable of recommending solutions to customer requests and technical issues.

0 to 3 years professional experience.

Completed or working towards a BA/BS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related technical field.

Due to Covid-19, we've transitioned to a work-from-home model and we're continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We are forward to welcoming our teams back to a safe and collaborative workplace environment in August 2021. Employee safety is top of mind as we transition back to the office and we will be taking all precautions seriously. For more information on how we are doing this, please speak with one of our HR team members.

HG Insights Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Please note that HG Insights does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the event of a recruiter or agency submitting a resume or candidate without a signed agreement being in place, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire such candidates without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted directly to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of HG Insights

Full Job Description
The Computational Photography group in Facebook Reality Labs (FRL) brings together a world-class R&D team of researchers, and engineers to build innovative photo, video, and AR/VR experiences. We work on technologies that ship across all Facebook surfaces ranging from Facebook to Instagram to the AR/VR Oculus products. We work at the intersection of Computer Vision, Computer Graphics, and ML. The aim of this role is to develop and advance the state-of-the-art in computational photography. The goal of the internship is both to create a publishable research project and contribute to new methodologies that can be experienced by billions around the globe.
Research, develop and prototype advanced technologies in the domain of computer vision, computer graphics, and machine learning.
Analyze and improve efficiency, accuracy, scalability and stability of currently deployed systems Collaborate with team members throughout the lifetime of a project, from prototyping to deployed products.
Deliver research results that are both publishable and have a direct impact on Facebook and/or Oculus products.
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD degree in the field of Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related technical field.
1+ year of experiences in one or more areas of Computer Science, such as Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Computer Graphics, Image Processing, and Computational Photography.
Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by grants, fellowships, patents, as well as co-authored publications at top-tier conferences such as CVPR/ECCV/ICCV, SIGGRAPH (Asia), NeurIPS/ICLR/ICML, etc.
2+ years of experiences in modern C++ and/or Python.
1+ year of experiences with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op.
Strong communication skills and ability to convey research ideas to a broad audience.
Broad understanding of the full machine vision pipeline from sensors to high-level algorithms.
Relevant research or software engineering work experiences, including internship, work experience, coding competitions, or widely used contributions in open source repositories (e.g. GitHub).
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Full Job Description
BDO’s Core Purpose is Helping People Thrive Every Day. Our Core Values reflect how we manage our work, our relationships and ourselves. As an employee of the firm, you will live true to our Core Values of people first, being exceptional every day in every way, embracing change, feeling empowered through knowledge and choosing accountability. Full Job Description
Becht is a 5 STAR rated Glassdoor, a Top 100 Best Places to Work in New Jersey according to NJBIZ and a Great Place to Work-Certified™ company!

Please attach a recent unofficial transcript with your resume. If you are a Master's degree student, please also upload your Bachelor's degree transcript. Failure to do so will create a delay in the review of your application.

Who is Becht?
Founded in 1964, Becht is a rapidly-growing, multi-discipline consulting firm relied on by customers to relentlessly solve their most difficult and entrenched problems. We combine vast experience through our network of over 1500 technical experts with both engineering expertise and professional experience. Becht is a company founded on excellence, and as such we seek individuals who want to be part of our passionate and energetic team.

Who Do We Want?
Becht is seeking junior, senior, master’s or doctorate computer science/software engineering students with interest in web app development with a database back end who want to learn more by joining our world-class, family-owned engineering organization. Becht is committed to developing young professionals by providing opportunities to explore the dynamic environment of engineering consulting services. Becht strives to provide the student with:
  • Real world experience with a consulting company operating with the latest technology
  • Guidance in the form of a highly trained mentor
  • A positive, team approach work environment
  • Hands on experience with the full SDLC during your internship
At Becht, our intern/co-op program gives students the opportunity to explore the practical applications of their college classes while working with customers from around the globe. We offer full-time student positions for every semester. These positions actively support current projects and are constantly evolving. As a student with Becht, you will learn to develop internal and client facing web apps, web pages, and productivity tools with a team of other software developers and engineers. You will be involved in the entire process from setting application requirements, creating data models, and designing the interface, developing the front and back ends, testing and assisting in deployment. You will be at the forefront of our most advanced and technically rewarding projects to assist clients in improving reliability and profitability while also reducing risks to people and the environment.

Build Your Career with Becht
A creative and innovative work environment isn’t all we have to offer! When you join Becht, you can expect:
  • A positive, collaborative workforce
  • Access to further training and development
  • Mentoring programs
  • Company and family events such as baseball games, go-karting, and bowling
  • Opportunities that provide stability as well as variety
  • Work day events such as birthday lunches
  • Community outreach programs such as Red Cross blood drives, Toys for Tots collections/volunteering, and United Way campaigns
Your Knowledge and Expertise
  • Passion for technology and can navigate across complex and rapidly changing landscapes
  • Detail oriented and organized
  • Creative and confident to express new ideas
  • Proven troubleshooting skills
  • Self-motivated and self-disciplined
  • Should be comfortable working in a virtual team
  • Ability to compartmentalize efforts—put one task down, pick up another, then resume the first with minimal ramp up required
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Object oriented programming experience
  • Database experience
  • MSSQL, Bootstrap, C# and/or .NET Core experience are a plus.
  • Must be enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Software Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent, degree
  • Must be available to work 40 hours per week for a minimum of one semester
  • Remote or must be local or willing to temporarily relocate to the Medina, OH; Liberty Corner, NJ; or Humble, Houston, TX areas or KC or MO; Northland area.
6 months Internship/Co-op blocks are preferred.

BECHT is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Full Job Description
Leading the future of luxury mobility
Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.
We are actively seeking an Intern, Battery Cell Engineering for this upcoming Fall 2021 term. This position requires an enthusiastic professional with a strong understanding of lithium-ion cell chemistry and statistical programming. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.
Responsibilities
Work closely with Cell Team members to develop experiments, analyze electrochemical datasets, and produce data-driven insights.
Perform cell cycling and specialized battery cell-related tests.
Contribute to special prototype R&D projects.
Attend regular group and 1-1 meetings to present progress updates.
Clearly document work progress and conclusions. Qualifications
Associate’s, Bachelor’s, or Post-Secondary Degree in Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Material Science Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Physics, Chemistry, and other related fields. (Recent graduates are eligible up to 12 months after graduation)
Strong knowledge of lithium-ion cell chemistry and general electrochemistry
Proficient in a statistical programming language for data analysis and designing experiments
Experience with analyzing large data sets
High level of mathematical and data analysis capabilities
Highly organized, able to manage multiple tests, and great documentation skills
Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude
Comfortable with taking ownership of projects
Preferred Qualifications
1+ years of experience with battery testing equipment (Maccor, Arbin, etc.) and electrochemical lab work
Expertise with MATLAB, Python, or other relevant programming languages
Experience in navigating and using a database Other
Programming Timing: September 7th – November 26th, 2021 (12 weeks); End date can be extended up to December 23rd, 2021 based on individual needs; Some flexibility with start date is available if needed
Availability: Full-time preferred but Part-Time available
Location: This position is in Newark, CA. You must be prepared to start on site for your first day of employment
Work Environment: Production Lab
Anticipated Hours: 8:30 am – 5:30 pm
Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable
Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization
Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week
Housing: No compensation for housing
Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses currently
Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence
Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area
Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check
Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors, you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers, or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department. Be part of something amazing
Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.
At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.
To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Full Job Description
Inceptio Technology's vision is to create a nationwide network of autonomous trucking service. We build close relationships with freight, logistics and automotive partners to transform the line-haul transportation industry. Our goal is to provide safe and efficient logistical assets at an optimized cost. Established in April 2018, Inceptio Technology has brought together a world class team to develop Level 3 and Level 4 autonomous technology.

Inceptio Technology was co-founded by G7, China's leading IoT company, Global Logistic Properties Ltd (GLP) and NIO CAPITAL.

Project Name: Cybersecurity software development for M51 – the project is to implement cybersecurity measures in software to protect our AD system from both internal and external attacks.

Responsibilities:
1. Project scope:
Follow Inceptio's design docs to build basic Crypto APIs for the following functionalities:

Keys/certificates management

Cybersecurity measures like encryption, decryption, and auditing

The above functions shall be implemented using Intel instructions and TPM 2.0.

Work with our developer to implement storage security for our orchestration subsystem.

Work with our developer to implement communication security and auditing for our remote management subsystem.

Work with our developer to implement disk access control for all AD applications.

Follow Inceptio's design docs to implement our software licensing mechanism.

Set up proper firewall using packet filters on QNX.

Set up and optimize security policy on QNX for our AD system.

2. Programming language: C++14

3. Code management:
All source codes shall be archived and managed on Inceptio's Gitlab.

Integration with Inceptio's CI procedure

All source code shall be properly documented with both inline comments and design documents.

The building procedure shall be properly documented.

Train our developers to build the source codes and use the APIs

4. Project management:
The Interns are expected to join daily stand-up and submit weekly status.

The interns are expected to be on-site (either in Shanghai or Fremont) more than 3 days per week as the access to our AD hardware M51 is limited in our office.

The contractor team needs to provide a point of contact for project management communications.

5. Equipment provided by company: M51 (only onsite access)

Qualifications:
Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science or related Engineering Field

Excellent C++ programing

Familiar with Linux environment

Preferred Experience:
Have experience on cybersecurity

Have used TPM (Trust Platform Module)

Have development experience on QNX

position: Exciting Business Marketing Internship at Sports AI Start-Up Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description

Sparrow is an early-stage startup that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help athletes improve.

We are offering a valuable Business Marketing Spring internship for a bright, motivated, resourceful college student or recent college graduate looking to learn the ins and outs of the startup, A.I., and sports worlds.

You’ll work closely with the company’s serial-entrepreneur CEO & core business marketing team to strategize and execute the 2021 agenda, including:

  • Sparrow's app store launch
  • Email marketing campaigns
  • User feedback communication
  • Data analytics system
  • Social media presence (including content creation)
  • Public relations
  • Influencer outreach
  • And much more!

Person sought must:

  • Be a student at or a recent graduate of a reputable 4-year college, with either a business, communications or marketing related degree and/or experience
  • Be able to work an 8 hour work day (-40 hours per week) end of May through end of August 2021 or longer
  • Be uber-productive, able to switch between different kinds of tasks, and comfortable taking on all jobs complex or mundane.
  • Be experienced and comfortable using online tools like G Suite, email marketing platforms and social media outlets like Youtube, Instagram, and Twitter.
  • Be very detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative
  • Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

  • Work closely with the company founders, successful serial entrepreneurs who have started numerous companies, raised over $20 million in venture capital for them, and have 2 successful exits. (check out our founders here: https://youtu.be/r82gufgzltg)
  • Learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started
  • Receive a $50 weekly stipend, college credit and potentially earn an equity bonus (stock options), and more importantly gain relationships in the tech, AI, and sports industry

Testimonials from Sparrow’s Intern Classes

* My time at Sparrow has been great! I’ve learned the ins and outs of what it takes to successfully run a business + gained valuable insight from the founders. -Gabriel R., Yale University (Men’s Varsity Golf, Econ)

* I was given real responsibilities while working alongside people who really exemplified what it means to be a part of a team. - Georgia L., Williams College (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Psych Major)

*I definitely feel as though I’m honing important skills and experience for when I enter the job market.” said the rising senior. - Abby E., Pomona College in CA (Women’s Varsity Golf, Psych Major)

*At Sparrow I assisted with fundraising rounds, analyzing consumer/user data & conceptualizing macro marketing schemes - experiences that will help me for years to come. - Nick S., USC (Business Major)

* I loved getting exposure into the fast paced start-up world - my internship with Sparrow was awesome!

- Rebecca R., Brown University (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Applied Math major)

* Interning at Sparrow was so valuable! I got to work with the founders and see first hand how a successful company is made! - Annie M, Lehigh (Womens’ Varsity Lacrosse, Business Major)

* My internship with Sparrow was great! I worked on an investment and PR project that contributed to the launch of the company. - Colette M., Columbia University (Women's Varsity Soccer)

** My internship with Sparrow was a valuable one. I worked closely with the co-founders & gained valuable insight into the inner workings of a great startup. - Adam X., Harvard University (Men’s Varsity Golf)

* I worked with an expert machine learning advisor, got my name on a patent and had an all around amazing experience with Sparrow! Trevor J., University of Michigan (Computer Science Major)

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $50.00 per week

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
We are working entirely remotely to ensure the safety of all employees while also staying on track with the goals of the company.

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

  • Digital Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Business: 1 year (Preferred)

Full Job Description

Machine Learning Engineering Intern: Environmental, Social, Governance (ESG) Investment Model Development

LOCATION: Remote and/or Tysons Corner, VA

POSITION HIGHLIGHTS:

Verstand AI (www.verstand.ai) is seeking interns with an interest in building custom data product and artificial intelligence solutions for clients in the financial services industry. Armed with knowledge of data science applications and machine learning algorithms, the machine learning intern will be instrumental in building high quality datasets to fine tuning models (building and retraining models) for maximizing performance. Along with the management of cloud environments,
Verstand interns will be responsible for ensuring data quality, scoring and evaluation of models, and continuous model operations. Additionally, support will be handed to Data Engineers to build ETL pipelines and BI Designers to design visualizations and dashboards. Knowledge of capital markets and trading strategies an advantage.

Most importantly, Verstand AI's interns will get an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies and be part of data teams that help clients harness the power of artificial intelligence. Verstand’s interns will shape and build efficient and self-learning applications.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Work with product owners, data engineers, and BI designers to understand product requirements, data needs, and model design
  • Acquire data and build custom datasets using web-scraping or NLP tools
  • Perform data analysis on large structured or unstructured datasets, using machine learning to enrich data features and data quality
  • Design and build data extraction, transformation, and loading processes by writing custom data pipelines
  • Design, implement and support platforms that can provide ad-hoc access to large datasets and unstructured data
  • Perform model parameter and hyperparameter fine tuning to optimize model learn rates and maximize model performance
  • Participate in feature engineering planning sessions
  • Develop multiple model scoring and evaluation methodologies
  • Design visualizations and dashboards for reporting and rich storytelling

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum Experience, Skills and Education:

  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms, their application for problem solving and MLOps
  • Strong Python, Java, R and SQL skills with understanding of software development
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, and statistics
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Could Platform (GCP)
  • Working knowledge of Python Machine Learning libraries (SciKit Learn, TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras)
  • Experience with base level data Python libraries (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Scapy, NLTK)
  • Working knowledge of scoring and evaluating machine learning models
  • Working knowledge of ETL pipelines and data ingestion methodology
  • Working knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI, Looker and Tableau
  • Effective written/spoken communication skills and strong problem-solving skills
  • Currently enrolled in Bachelor's degree from four-year College or university in Computer Science, Data Science or related field

Experience That Sets You Apart:

  • Experience with capital markets, time series analysis, trading strategies and algorithms
  • Experience and interest in ESG reporting, data points, and standards

Verstand AI is a fast-growing firm that believes in ongoing training and development for its staff. The firm's mission is to help both its commercial and public sector clients resolve data management challenges and move to delivering insight and benefits for stakeholders, customers and constituents.

Based out of Tysons Corner, VA, Verstand does business across the United States and is moving into Europe and Asia. If you're interested in working with us and have a desire to tackle challenging data problems, we welcome your interest and encourage you to apply.

Summary:

Acronis SCS is an American cyber protection and edge data security company exclusively dedicated to meeting the unique requirements of the US public sector. Our innovative and comprehensive cyber protection, backup and disaster recovery, anti-ransomware, and enterprise file sync and share software solutions ensure operational assurance and data security across America’s federal, state and local government, education, healthcare, and nonprofit computing environments.

Position Overview:

The “ground floor” position of Data Software Engineering Intern is designed for a master’s student in computer science having the ability to work 15 hours per week while school is in session and fulltime (40 hours/week) during school’s recess.

This position will be responsible for assisting with ongoing cybersecurity research activities. We are looking for someone with solid computer science (CS) foundations consisting of the core CS curriculum as taught in American universities at the undergraduate level. Specifically, we are searching for a student who is an expert in Python and R and standard Python machine learning libraries. If you are looking for a fun environment creating innovative solutions to challenging problems while raising the standards for secure backup and recovery, this is the position for you.

Job Responsibilities:

· Curate data and performing ETL

· Machine learning model development and testing

· Analysis of results

· Document, find, and assist in scholarly research

· Explore GitHub and other source code repositories and identify source code on interest

· Scrape GitHub and parse data

· Transform and data into MySQL

· Analyze source code

· Build and test machine learning and statistical models

· Interpret and document the results

· Participate in ongoing research and help author scholarly articles

· Work with data, structured and unstructured

· Manage data and performing ETL including web scraping (from e.g., GitHub.)

· Visualizing data

· Develop software modules (in e.g., Python,) exploring new tools and methods.

Details:

This position is three (3) months in duration with an option to extend.

The position is fully remote. Time flexible.

Required Skills:

· Demonstrated competence of the standard computer science undergraduate curriculum.

· Knowledge of the methods and tools of data science with Python and Jupyter Notebooks.

· Experience working with “big data”, structured and unstructured including natural language processing (NLP).

· Curiosity, enthusiasm, eagerness to learn. Team player.

Required Qualifications

· Must be a U.S. citizen.

· Bachelor’s degree in computer science, working towards a master’s degree in computer science.

· Experience with Python’s Pandas, Sklearn, PyPlots, TensorFlow and similar software libraries related to machine learning.

· Excellent communicator both verbally and in writing

NEXT STEPS:

After successfully applying to this position the next steps will consist of one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists reviewing your resume and qualifications. Should you meet the qualifications outlined in the job description you will be contacted to schedule a preliminary phone interview.

Full Job Description
ABOUT US:
Scripps Research is ranked the most influential institution in the world for its impact on innovation. We expand basic knowledge in the biosciences, and use these fundamental advancements to develop profound innovations that improve wellbeing. Our educational and training programs mold talented and committed students and postdocs into leading edge scientists. Scientists in the institute’s five academic research departments work hand-in-hand with researchers of the Scripps Research Translational Institute and Calibr to merge foundational studies in biology, chemistry and computer science with translational science to produce pioneering drugs and advances in digital and precision medicine. Together, we cultivate new scientific leaders and expand the frontiers of knowledge to deliver medical breakthroughs to better human health around the globe. If you have a passion for making a difference, this could be your opportunity to join our transformative team.

POSITION TITLE: Intern-Research

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Lippi Lab in the Neuroscience Department at Scripps Research, La Jolla, is currently seeking an Intern. Interns receive occupational experience, closely supervised training and are able to develop their professional skills. Previous Interns have been admitted to top graduate programs.

Duties include basic laboratory maintenance such as glassware washing; autoclaving; media, solution, and buffer prep; replenish supplies and follow experimental procedures assigned by laboratory staff. For information about the kind of research performed in the Lippi lab please visit:

https://giordano-lippi-na8a.squarespace.com/

Part-time: Up to 19 hours per week.
This position is not eligible for benefits.
This is a year-round position, not a summer intern or other short-term internship.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
This position works in a laboratory or vivarium environment. Further details of the physical requirements of established essential functions for this position will be addressed/discussed during the interview process.

REQUIREMENTS:
Requires current enrollment in either a high school or college/university educational program. Undergraduate enrolled in a relevant scientific program, e.g., biological or life science, strongly preferred.

Previous experience with wet lab work preferred. A commitment to at least two years in the lab strongly preferred.

The above statements describe the level of work performed and expected in general terms. The statements are not intended to list all the responsibilities, duties and/or skills required of employees so classified, and the content herein is subject to change due to the business needs of Scripps Research, with or without notice. Furthermore, nothing in this job description shall be interpreted to be in conflict with or to eliminate or modify in any way the employment-at-will status of Scripps Research staff.

EEO Statement: Scripps is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

COVID-19 update:
The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until restrictions change, interviews will be conducted virtually. New hires will work remotely, unless specifically authorized for campus access.

Full Job Description
The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

At the end of the intern's tour, they will provide a presentation of their work to their fellow interns and researchers.

The NSA facilities are located in and around Fort Meade, Maryland.

Job Summary

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

Qualifications

' Must be a U.S. citizen.
' Must be eligible to be granted a security clearance.
' Must be available for an operational interview and other applicable processing between the months of November 2021 and March 2022.
' Applicants should have demonstrated superior STEM aptitude and problem-solving skills. Evidence of successful work on an independent STEM project is desirable. Applicants may be at any stage in their undergraduate or graduate careers and working, or intending to work, in any STEM area.
' Desired majors include, but not restricted to, computer science, cybersecurity, engineering, information technology, mathematics, and psychology.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

  • Students are paid a competitive salary commensurate with their education level.
  • Receive annual leave, sick leave and paid federal holidays.
  • Participation in agency-wide extracurricular programs.
  • Students who attend schools in excess of 75 miles from Ft. Meade, MD, are eligible for a round trip airfare ticket to and from school or mileage reimbursement up to the cost of a government-issued airline ticket.
  • Daily transportation to and from work is not provided. Students participating in the program are highly encouraged to bring a vehicle. Carpooling with other students MAY be available but NOT guaranteed.
  • Subsidized housing accommodations are available upon request if school is located in excess of 75 miles from NSA main HQs campus.
How to apply

Submit an online application on or before 31 October 2021.

Send an applicant package to sos.research@nsa.gov; you will receive an email confirmation upon receipt.

Applicant packages should include:
' Resume,
' One page essay on the applicant research experience and/or interests,
' Most recent transcript(s) that show academic performance - Unofficial copies are accepted, and
' A letter of recommendation (LOR) from a faculty member or research mentor who can speak to your research experience/background (LORs attached to the application package or sent directly from the recommender to sos.research@nsa.gov are accepted).

Early Acceptance Incentive;
The application period runs until 31 October 2021. However, the Agency will determine selections for early acceptance into the program on a rolling basis throughout the application period and anticipates filling approximately 1/3 of the available positions prior to the closing of the application period.

If you have questions about the Science of Security Intern Program, please contact us at the email address above or call 1-844-ICHIRES. You may also e-mail summerinterns@uwe.nsa.gov for application questions.

***PLEASE NOTE:
U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph.

This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.

DCIPS Disclaimer

The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.

The Solutions Delivery Intern is part of a multi-semester long professional internship program. The internship will consist of a focused project in the subject area of the internship, working closely with a leader who will mentor you. High preforming interns may be offered full-time positions post-graduation. You will be paid a competitive hourly rate for the internship. In addition, many interns may receive academic credit for their work through their college or university.

What you’ll do

Support day-to-day applications, data, reporting, and analytics projects and complete ad hoc application requests
Provide historical, current, and predictive views of business operations to support key partners in decision making across the enterprise
Build/analyze data sources to understand key drivers of the business
Creatively and rigorously apply modern techniques to a wide range of business problems

What we’re looking for

College Junior or Senior within one to two years of graduation
An interest in pursuing a career with Kum & Go post-graduation
Must be able to complete at least 240 hours during the summer 2021
Must have completed high school in Iowa or currently attend an Iowa community college, private college, or Board of Regents institution

Other key requirements

Pursuing an undergraduate degree in MIS, Computer Science or other STEM major (master’s or doctorate students not eligible)
Detail oriented and process-thinker
Excellent writing and communication skills
Experience in Microsoft Technologies preferred

Leadership Competencies

Communication: Delivers clear, effective communication and listens to others
Conceptual/Systems Thinking: Recognizes patterns, trends, themes, and connections in information to develop innovative ideas and solutions
Constructive Engagement: Expresses ideas and disagreements, constructively resolves conflict, and encourages others to do the same
Customer Orientation: Meets the expectations and needs of internal and external customers
Decision Making: Makes good decisions in a timely manner
Empowerment: Takes initiative and solves problems
Talent Development: Maximizes potential and improves overall performance
Influence: Proactively builds relationships and influences others
Analytical Thinking/Problem Solving: Accurately assesses problems and effectively and efficiently arrives at solutions
Strategic Thinking: Understands the current state and is able to visualize the ideal state and how to achieve it

About Kum & Go

At Kum & Go, our purpose is to make days better. We do that by connecting with people. Every day, whether in stores or at our Store Support Center headquarters, we take a people-first approach to developing associates, serving customers, and solving problems. We provide a unique working experience where associates are given many opportunities to make connections and to have fun along the way. Our culture is supported by our five core values:

Passion - We love what we do, and it shows in our work.
Integrity - We do the right thing, even when it is difficult.
Teamwork - We believe that greatness is only achieved in unity.
Caring - We have genuine compassion for our customers, associates, families, and communities.
Excellence - We expect and deliver superior performance.

For nearly 60 years, Kum & Go has been dedicated to the communities it serves, sharing 10 percent of its profits with charitable causes. For four generations, the family-owned convenience store chain has focused on providing exceptional service and delivering more than customers expect. Established in Hampton, Iowa, in 1959, the chain has since grown to employ more than 5,000 associates in more than 400 stores in 11 states (Iowa, Arkansas, Colorado, Minnesota, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, North Dakota, Oklahoma, South Dakota, and Wyoming).

Kum & Go is an Equal Opportunity Employer

LET’S TALK ABOUT YOU

Your profile: Application Programming Intern

(Preferred) Rising junior or senior status in a top computer science undergraduate program or graduate of a top-ranked coding bootcamp. Other backgrounds encouraged to apply with sufficient proof of knowledge and skills.

Experience in mobile application development in any general-purpose programming language. This does not have to be strictly in a professional capacity. Applicants are encouraged (preferred) to demonstrate their ability with examples of completed projects.

(Required) Fluency in two or more programming languages such as Python, Ruby/Ruby on Rails, JavaScript/React Native, Swift (preferred), Java, or Kotlin.

Ability to independently code a minimum viable product (MVP) application in 3-4 weeks with weekly or biweekly iterations thereafter. Knowledge of A/B testing a must. Ability to triage and iterate application features quickly and have a solid understanding of industry-accepted debugging/testing/troubleshooting methodologies.

General understanding of UI/UX design principles. Ease and enjoyment of use is as important, if not slightly more so, than core app functionality.

Knowledge of lean startup methodology (think: Y Combinator or 500Startups). Must be able to think critically, creatively, and efficiently with minimal oversight to accomplish tasks.

Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States without need for current or future employer-sponsored work authorization. Siemens Energy employees with current visa sponsorship may be eligible for internal transfers.

Your responsibilities

Collaborate with a small team to develop specs for a 3-sided marketplace app. Due to the small team size, your thoughts and inputs will play an immediate and significant role in development.

Serve as the lead programmer for developing the MVP of a mobile-first platform.

Provide key project deliverables at major milestones.

Your opportunities for personal growth

Play a foundational role in the growth and development of a “tech startup” project within a leading energy technology company.

As a key team member, you will gain experience working directly with senior business and engineering professionals at Siemens Energy.

LET’S TALK ABOUT US

"Let’s make tomorrow different today" is our genuine commitment at Siemens Energy to all customers and employees on the way to a sustainable future.

In our Business Functions we enable our organization to reach their targets by providing best-in class services and solutions in the areas of IT, HR, Finance, Real Estate, Strategy & Technology and more.

Greenspace is a technology startup project from the Siemens Energy Incubator with the goal of disrupting how companies highlight their green and sustainable initiatives and acquire top talent. We want to become the “matchmaker” between companies and job seekers by revolutionizing the job search process. The goal is to have the feel of a dating app, but for employers and prospective employees, by creating a streamlined and interactive way to align values and determine fit. The project has received seed funding and is now ready to be developed and beta tested. This phase of the project is focused on achieving the following goals: 1) rapidly develop an MVP for release, 2) acquire initial users for beta testing (early adopters), and 3) iterate, iterate, iterate. Greenspace is an exciting opportunity to have the full flexibility of a tech startup supported by the resources of a global energy technology corporation.

MORE INSIGHTS

Be Energized. Be you.

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and compassion. Our combined creative energy is fueled by at least 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society. All of society.

position: Network Operations Engineer (1); Team Lead Service Desk (1)--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please.
description:
Full Job Description
Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
