description:
Full Job Description
Software Engineer Intern Siemens EDA has an opportunity for a Software Engineer Intern. The Software Engineer Intern will work in our Infrastructure and Security team to provide services to the development teams and management across the Electronic Board Systems division. The ideal candidate will have skills in C/C++ and Java, and will also be capable of using Python, shell scripts, and application-specific development environments to build process-oriented analytical data presentation and reporting tools. Primary Responsibilities:
Static analysis reporting
Develop baseline and ongoing reports from static analysis tools for use in reporting to Siemens management. These tools are run on our C++ and Java code bases. A key aspect of this work is the assessment of the quality of the static analysis process and identifying high-priority fixes for the code being analyzed. This responsibility will require strong C++ and/or Java competency.
Build an interface to import static analysis output into our defect management system so that issues can be systematically addressed by the responsible development team.
Open Source Vulnerability reporting
Design and implementation of automated reporting out of an existing enterprise system that provides information on vulnerabilities reported in 3rd party components used in our products. This reporting will also include automated import of this information into our defect management system.
Use of dynamic analysis testing tools for penetration testing of web-based and cloud-based applications
Evaluate available penetration testing tools as directed by senior members of the team. Run penetration tests, develop extensions to the tools, and identify and report defects in existing applications.
Technical content delivery
Use an internal content management system to provide documentation of work on the above projects as well as collaborating with senior engineers to improve existing documentation where required.

Qualifications:
Completion of sophomore year undergraduate Computer Science / Computer Engineering / Mathematics or other Engineering programs.
Strong competency in C/C++ and Java, including the ability to both, develop new code and read existing code

Skills with Python or other scripting environments to build interfaces between internal systems
Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to work in both a team environment and independently
Confidence in decisions and ability to advocate those decisions to senior engineers
Insatiable intellectual curiosity

Duration:
8 months, part-time engagement August-May, with the possibility of extension of employment through the summer semester.

The hourly rate range for this position is from $21.00 - $27.00.

Organization: Digital Industries

Company: Siemens Industry Software Inc.

Experience Level: Student (Not Yet Graduated)

Job Type: Full-time

Full Job Description
Are you ready to join a growing team that puts a premium on productivity and has an award-winning culture, centered around transforming talented employees into effective business leaders?

Then Bankers Healthcare Group is the place for you. We offer innovative financial solutions to licensed and highly-skilled professionals, representing the best of both traditional lending and fintech, and are looking for passionate, impact players to help take our company to the next level.

At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.

With over 19 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

Who You Are
You are a motivated student who is passionate about Salesforce. You excel at the design, development, and implementation of Salesforce as a foundational platform across all business units.
You have experience assisting in large, complex Salesforce projects and are passionate about technology, quality, and the Salesforce platform. Additionally, you have a keen sense of process improvement and a strong desire to solve business problems.
What You'll Do
Assist in design and development of end to end Automated Regression and Performance test scripts where Salesforce is core to the solution and architecture
Assist with defining end to end testing process and methods in Salesforce environment, including cross-system integrations across multiple work streams
Review user stories and translate them into test plans and test cases
Execute manual test cases/scripts to ensure delivery of quality software and log/track defects
Work with product owners, business analysts, and technical teams such as Salesforce Development, web development, Integrations, and Database teams to discuss test results and troubleshoot issues
Participate in business requirements and technical requirements meetings and all Agile ceremonies
Research and find opportunities to utilize SFDC QA best practices, guidelines to improve system productivity, scaling, and monitoring
Participate and conduct smoke testing for the monthly/weekly release process
What You'll Need
Pursuing Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
Practical experience in testing technology solutions
Experience in building and maintaining automated test scripts
Experience with Sales Cloud, Communities, and Service Cloud highly desired
Salesforce Certified highly desired
Expertise in using integration middleware, knowledge of databases, Azure/Cloud
Aptitude for troubleshooting and problem solving
Strong sense of ownership and accountability with a commitment to delivering high-quality software that balances technical and business goals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate with a variety of audiences at all levels
Experience in using integration middleware (APIs), CI/CD (i.e Teamcity, Jenkins, Git), Cloud (i.e Azure, AWS, GoogleCloud) and knowledge of databases (i.e MongoDB, SQL) is a plus
Experience in C#/.NET development is preferred
Life at BHG
At BHG, we work hard and aren’t afraid to take risks. Since the beginning, our core values of PMA (positive mental attitude), team player and loyalty have been the driving force behind every interaction we have between each other and our customers. We have a healthy respect for the daily grind, yet we value work/life balance. We believe that all employees should have the opportunity to lead and that good ideas can come from anyone. From the top-down, our leaders are actively involved not only in strategic oversight and running the business, but also in the wellbeing and growth of all employees. We consider people our #1 asset, and help employees realize their full potential, set and exceed their goals, and explore new opportunities for personal and professional development.

Why You Should Join BHG
We strive to offer amenities, opportunities, events, and programming that support the interests of our teams, while furthering the culture that makes us Great Place to Work® certified. Some of the benefits you can expect when you join BHG include:

  • 100% coverage of monthly health insurance premiums
  • Competitive PTO and vacation policies
  • Company 401(k) plan with employer contributions after one year
  • On-site gym access and memberships, with personal trainers, and certified nutritionists on staff
  • Company-sponsored training and certification opportunities
  • Monthly award ceremonies where top achievers are celebrated and receive additional bonuses
  • Ongoing volunteer opportunities to give back to the community through our BHG Cares program
If you’re ready for a career where you can exercise your passions, be surrounded by co-workers who are relentlessly committed to service, and have a team-player mindset, apply today!

** All Remote employee's at Bankers Healthcare Group are required to work within the United States of America.

Bankers Healthcare Group is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Bankers Healthcare Group is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

What we offer

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

The Intelligent Enterprise Solutions (IES) department is responsible for evolving SAP’s IT strategy and executing on it. We are applying our expertise in technology and business processes by driving the internal adoption of standard applications that support end-users in the execution and re-engineering of their processes in all lines of business, always putting a strong focus on end-user centricity. It is our objective to accelerate co-innovation with development and extend the use of SAP standard products within SAP, shifting the focus from maintaining a heavily customized environment to optimizing our processes on top of standard services. By combining technological understanding with business know how and using our own innovative solutions as earliest adopter, we ensure zero distance between business and technology and act as ultimate proof point in SAP’s transition to a cloud company.

Within the IES, the Cloud Integration & Adoption (CIA) team is responsible for both, laying the E2E foundation across all IE Business Solutions as well as enabling continuous integration of SAP’s acquired cloud lines of business. We are working in a global virtual team setup and are agilists by heart. In addition to our day-to-day we love virtual hangouts across all teams.
Your team, Program & Solution Office leverages the advantages of agile scaling to coordinate value delivery and contribute to CIA’s operational excellence. #on a mission

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Integration Programs
Location: Newtown Square, PA
Expected Start Date: July 2021

Contract Duration: 6 to 12 months

In this role, you’ll:
We are looking for a motivated intern who would like to get to know SAP and work with us on improving our day-to-day business in a scaled agile operating environment. Being part of the CIA Program & Solution Office you will closely collaborate with our technical project teams, Release Train Engineers and colleagues all around the world:

You will work on one of our largest SAP Concur IT Transformation programs, where your project will optimizing the IT Application landscape for SAP Concur by migrating 100+ applications from the legacy single-sign on to SAP state of the art solutions, enhancing 10.000+ users experience tremendously
Under the larger umbrella of the program, you will also touch several other workstreams where we build up the future application landscape as well as moving our infrastructure cloud landscape
Both, the project as well as the umbrella program will contribute to advancement of end user experience, enablement of further business growth/customer success as well as making sure we roll on a secure, reliable and compliant foundation
Your role will be contributing to managing the project and its several streams, supporting the coordination of the migration of 100+ applications as well as applying technical knowledgein single sign-on, access & authorizations
Work closely with the technical program managers
Organize the stakeholder alignments with the business & technical owners per application
Support to design and launch the user communication as well as the related stakeholders such as IT Delivery Units, ServiceDesk and others
Support to coordinate the work per application based on a standardized mini-project-plan
Track open action items, service requests, report on status & associated risks
Highlight dependencies and foster cross-team collaboration
Work on the technical migration (SSO, SAML)
Work will be remote during the pandemic and regulatory working hours apply 40h/week

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Student (d/f/m) at a university or a university of applied sciences
Preferred fields of study: Computer Science, Business Informatic, Other IT/Technology related fields of study
Preferrably interested in technical project management roles
Agilist Mindset
Computer skills: Excellent knowledge of MS Office applications, ideally knowledge of Sharepoint, Ruum, interested to learn new or enhance knowledge on access & authorizations, SSO, SAML, or similar
Language skills: Fluent in English (spoken and written) is mandatory
Soft skills: open-minded, being highly motivated, proactive, well-organized and with good communication skills
Having work experience is a plus
Active (agile) project management experience is a plus
Quality focus & Ability to work independently within an international, virtual and highly diverse team as well as having a positive self-motivated can-do attitude

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

We are SAP

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

Our inclusion promise

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

Full Job Description
If you are looking for an internship opportunity that delivers much more than a traditional internship, this opportunity may be for you! Training, mentoring, real-world assignments, collaboration, and certifications are all possibilities.

At Yellow, Salesforce.com is a key technology that provides business capabilities to Sales, Customer Service, Operations, Pricing, and many other areas.

Don’t know much about Salesforce.com? That’s ok . . . you will by the time your internship comes to an end. You’ll find that Salesforce.com is the world’s #1 CRM solution. It’s a SaaS based ecosystem that provides a wholistic view of the customer, enables analytics to make better and more timely business decisions, and customizes and scales for any size company.

Why would you want an internship with the Yellow Salesforce team? Here are just a few reasons:

Paid internship that could be year-round until you graduate.
Time commitments flex from 15 – 20 hours per week during semesters to full-time during breaks and summer.
Training on a world class CRM solution.
Mentoring from technology professionals at one of the largest transportation companies in North America.
Opportunities for certifications on Salesforce.com.
Exposure to and inclusion in an Agile delivery model delivering assignments and responsibilities for real world capabilities.
Develop your skills as well as interact with vendors (Salesforce.com) and solution partners.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Under direct supervision of a mentor, learn and develop skills in field of study.
Gain exposure to the business environment.
Perform basic tasks and administrative duties such as
Maintenance and monitoring of technical platforms and applications
Technology configuration
Analyze technical data and prepare conclusions
What responsibilities would a graduate student have that might be higher level?
Assist in report preparation and analysis.
Participate on group projects.

COMPETENCIES

Adaptability - Maintaining effectiveness when experiencing major changes in work responsibilities or environment (e.g., people, processes, structure, or culture); adjusting effectively to change by exploring the benefits, trying new approaches, and collaborating with others to make the change successful.
Building Trusting Relationships - Using appropriate interpersonal styles to establish effective relationships with customers and internal partners; interacting with others in a way that promotes openness and trust and gives them confidence in one’s intentions.
Collaborating - Working cooperatively with others to help a team or work group achieve its goals.
Communication - Conveying information and ideas clearly and concisely to individuals or groups in an engaging manner that help them understand and retain the message; listening actively to others.
Continuous Learning - Actively identifying new areas for learning; regularly creating and taking advantage of learning opportunities; using newly gained knowledge and skill on the job and learning through their application.
Initiating Action - Taking prompt action to accomplish work goals; taking action to achieve results beyond what is required; being proactive.
Work Standards - Setting high standards of performance for self and others; assuming responsibility and accountability for successfully completing assignments or tasks; self-imposing standards of excellence rather than having standards imposed.

BENEFITS

Competitive pay based on experience

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Grade point average 3.0 or better.
Demonstrated strong interpersonal communication skills.
Strong listening skills and ability to follow directions.
Effective oral, written and interpersonal skills.
Currently enrolled and pursuing undergraduate (at least second year student) or graduate degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science or like discipline.

WORKING CONDITIONS

This job operates in a professional office environment indoors. Routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The position requires the ability to spend long hours sitting or standing while using office equipment and computers. Ability to perform repetitive tasks such as typing and keying. Occasional lifting, pushing/pulling, carrying 10 lbs of supplies and materials is required.

position: SAP iXp Intern - Product Management for FinOps
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 286133
Work Area: Finance
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

SAP SuccessFactors is SAP’s largest Cloud Business and we are looking for an experienced and energetic intern to help us realize our vision of Next Generation Cloud Delivery! This is an incredible opportunity to advance your career and gain invaluable experience in cloud cost transformation and management program.

What you’ll do

Position title: SAP iXp Intern - Product Management for FinOps
Location: Virtual – USA
Expected start date to end date: May 2021

In this role, you’ll:
Get actively involved, experience personal development opportunities and expand your technical skills within a corporate culture with highly motivated and friendly colleagues
With One Strike, we are ramping Product Financials Track to work with Engineering and Product Management teams to create transparency and visibility on cost of cloud infrastructure spend by product, build dashboards and democratize the datasets for teams create actionable insights.
As a product management Intern, you will be working with Financial Operations track to interview and run design sessions with product management, engineering, cloud operations and business operations to build the dashboards and insights.
Gather requirements from product management, engineering, cloud operations and business operations, and write detailed product specifications for the Cost Utilization Dashboards.
Work with large datasets to support on cloud cost management, financial modeling and change of processes with focus on continuous improvement and in collaboration with the involved stakeholders
Creation, review and update of product requirements on Cost Utilization Dashboards with migration to Public Cloud
Work on technical and non-technical topics regarding architecture and services
Communicate Cost Utilization Dashboards capabilities and plans to internal audiences
Support in preparation and coordination of project tasks

Learning & Development Opportunities

Get deep insides into the methods, processes and tools related to cloud cost management.
Learn from subject matter expert on category management across SAP organizations
Business requirements gathering and refinement
Project management
Expand your network into different board areas and teams

Who you are

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Educational Requirements

Current student or recent graduate of a Bachelor's, Master's or MBA degree program
Field of study: Engineering, Computer Science, MBA
Computer skills: Microsoft Office

Soft skills

Desire to always be learning
Interest in defining software products
Collaborative team-player attitude
Fast Learner with aptitude to gain end user and customer IT perspective and distill the knowledge to drive product enhancements
Reliability and focus on high quality of work
Excellent presentation, oral, and written communication skills
Ability to work in a global, agile and diverse organization
Possess analysis skills to take data as input and output actionable recommendations
Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment

Desired Work experience

First experiences and knowledge in process management would be beneficial
Practical experiences on IT/ business processes (like ITIL) gained through other IT internships would be an asset

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. Full Job Description
  • This position is payrolled via payroll agency.
Group/Role Overview:
The Advanced Data Planning Technology Group at TTCA focuses on next generation patterning process and advanced tooling for use in semiconductor manufacturing. We optimize the processes and hardware used to develop patterning solutions for advanced front, middle, and back end of the line applications. TEL is looking for a data-focused individual who will work with semiconductor fabrication tools, data-collection tools, and the engineers who know their operation. This person will collect, sanitize and synthesize the data coming off the tool. The goals of this position are to find distillations and visualizations of our tool sensor data which assist process engineers in making decisions with an industrial collaborator in ML/NLP interfaces.

Responsibilities:
  • Ensure and maintain connectivity between tools and the data-collection tools to ensure proper gathering of metrics
  • Work closely with cross-functional engineering teams to troubleshoot process/integration problems
  • Help to compile and analyze measured data & developing heuristics for alerting
  • Establishing models for detecting anomalies in the data
  • Using other statistical tools to deliver distilled data and visualization to end-users
  • Working with engineers to develop recommendations and prepare changes, additions, and modifications, which will facilitate equipment operations, uptime and efficiency.
  • Work with process and hardware engineers on demo of on-tool data visualization
Qualifications:
  • An ideal candidate must have or be pursuing MS degree or higher in Computer Science, Data Science or some other analytical discipline
  • Strong technical background in mechanics of materials and mathematics
  • Experience with programming languages (R, Python, C-sharp, etc.)
  • Candidate with project management experience or having previously demonstrated a strong self-directed skill set is preferential
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills a must
  • Ability and desire to work in a multicultural team
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S without sponsorship

description:
Full Job Description
Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Earn money and gain valuable business experience to boost your resume. The internship will center around Data & Analytics, specifically focused on Business Intelligence utilizing Microsoft Power BI. The selected candidate will work with the leadership team to achieve assigned project goals and deliverables including management reports and dashboards.

The candidate will gain exposure to business, get experience developing requirements, utilizing blends of data architecture and structure while building relationships and meeting project deadlines.   • Familiarity with various database querying language, report development, presentation tools and techniques.

Work Environment
This job operates in an office setting. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

Temporal association of data from multiple sensors, including camera, LiDAR, RADAR and more
Object tracking and state estimation in challenging real world scenarios
Encoding perception uncertainty and collaborate with prediction team to make the system safe and robust

Responsibilities

Formulate, prototype and deploy robust and reliable solutions to cutting-edge perception problems, including sensor fusion, tracking, and state estimation.
Investigate and develop computer vision algorithms and machine learning models for the perception system.
Build benchmark with proper methodology and analyze large-scale data to characterize algorithms performance.
Closely collaborate with other teams to conduct system design, integration and tests.

Qualifications

M.S. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or other related fields.
Hands-on experience in computer vision, machine learning for perception, robotics, autonomous system, object tracking, sensor fusion, localization and mapping etc.
Strong coding skills in C/C++ and Python

Preferred

Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or other related fields.
Extensive experience in computer vision, machine learning for perception, robotics, autonomous system, object tracking, sensor fusion, localization and mapping etc.
Publications in top-tier computer vision/machine learning conferences and/or journals.
Knowledge and experience of GPU computation or CUDA acceleration.

Perks

Work with world class AI Engineers.

Shape the landscape of autonomous driving.

Daily breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

Full Kitchen with unlimited snacks and fruits.

Full Job Description

Group/Role Overview:
The Advanced Data Planning Technology Group at TTCA focuses on next generation patterning process and advanced tooling for use in semiconductor manufacturing. We optimize the processes and hardware used to develop patterning solutions for advanced front, middle, and back end of the line applications. TEL is looking for a data-focused individual who will work with semiconductor fabrication tools, data-collection tools, and the engineers who know their operation. This person will collect, sanitize and synthesize the data coming off the tool. The goals of this position are to find distillations and visualizations of our tool sensor data which assist process engineers in making decisions with an industrial collaborator in ML/NLP interfaces.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with cross-functional engineering teams to troubleshoot process/integration problems
  • Help to compile and analyze measured data & developing heuristics for alerting
  • Establishing models for detecting anomalies in the data
  • Using other statistical tools to deliver distilled data and visualization to end-users
  • Working with engineers to develop recommendations and prepare changes, additions, and modifications, which will facilitate equipment operations, uptime and efficiency.
  • Work with process and hardware engineers on demo of on-tool data visualization

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills a must
  • Ability and desire to work in a multicultural team

position: Network Operations Engineer (1); Team Lead Service Desk (1)--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please.
description:
Full Job Description
Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist

Full Job Description
About Monarch:
At Monarch, we are leading the digital transformation of farming. Monarch Tractor augments both muscle and mind with fully loaded hardware, software, and service machinery that will spur future generations of farming technologies.

With our farmer-first mentality, we are building a smart tractor that will enhance (not replace) the existing farm ecosystem, alleviate labor availability, and cost issues, and provide an avenue for competitive organic and beyond farming by providing mechanical solutions to replace harmful chemical solutions. Despite all the cutting-edge technology we will incorporate, our tractor will still plow, till, and haul better than any other tractor in its class. We have all the necessary ingredients to develop, build and scale the Monarch Tractor to digitally transform farming around the world.

Job Description

As a Network Engineer Intern, you will have hands-on experience in our company's computer network maintenance. You will need to be comfortable in a fast-paced startup environment where collaborating across various teams is expected. The ideal candidate would have knowledge of hardware, and software infrastructure protocols. You will also need to be able to implement, administer, and troubleshoot network devices, firewalls, and routers. Above all, we're looking for someone who's creative and has a can-do attitude, a lot of grit, and a sense of fun.

Network Engineer Responsibilities:
Maintain our company's computer networks, hardware, software, and other related systems.

Contribute to the development of the communication systems within our products, including vehicles, base stations and repeaters.

Implement advanced network configurations including VPNs, routing rules, QoS rules, tunnels, port forwarding, Etc.

Implement network security, including configuring firewalls, mac filters, Etc.

Create accurate network diagrams and documentation for design and planning of wired and wireless communication systems.

Provide field testing and benchmarks on our communication bandwidths/coverage.

Troubleshooting and resolving network and connectivity issues.

Identify production cost saving solutions on communication components, including routers, switches, radios, access points and antennas.

Additional responsibilities and tasks as needed.

Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in information technology related field of study with a network engineering focus.

CCNA certifications, including routing and switching, security, cloud, wireless, Etc.

Strong understanding of network infrastructure and network hardware.

Strong understanding of RF engineering, antenna specifications, Etc.

Ability to implement, administer, and troubleshoot network infrastructure devices, including wireless access points, firewall, routers and radios.

Ability to quickly learn new or unfamiliar technology and products using documentation and internet resources.

Ability to work with all levels of staff within and outside of IT and outside the organization.

A self-starter able to work independently but comfortable working in a team environment.

Good analytical and problem-solving skills.

Dependable and flexible when necessary.

Network security experience.

What you'll get:
At Monarch Tractor, you'll play a key role on a capable, dedicated, high-performing team of rock stars. This role offers a total immersion into a busy tech startup culture. A successful candidate may work closely with customers, collaborate with engineers, developers, and designers, to learn more about deploying a highly innovative product in the Agtech environment.

In addition to building outstanding products, we're building an outstanding company with culture to match. Part of what we do is be in our element, which means being on the farm. We will be spending lots of time in Napa, Sonoma, Monterey, and the central coast of California—perfecting our craft, mastering our environment, building our team camaraderie, and also taking time to enjoy the fruits of our labor.

At Monarch, we cherish and celebrate every individual's difference. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or another legally protected status.

position: Intern - MAGNet Program @ University of Georgia (Fall 2021)
description:
Full Job Description
Overview:
Intern- MAGNet Program @ University of Georgia (Fall 2021)

State Farm has developed a unique internship opportunity for graduate students at the University of Georgia (UGA) - the Modeling and Analytics Graduate Network (MAGNet). MAGNet interns apply their statistical modeling and analytic skills to a wide variety of business problems faced by the State Farm organization.

Most MAGNet interns are graduate students in the Statistics Department, but graduate students in other highly quantitative disciplines may also be considered. While participating in the MAGNet program, students are evaluated and given consideration for full time, post-graduate employment at various State Farm locations: Atlanta, GA; Bloomington, IL; Dallas, TX; or Champaign, IL.

MAGNet interns apply their predictive modeling and data analysis skills to a variety of data science problems, in many different lines of business and departments (e.g., marketing, insurance, and process optimization) including:
  • Pricing and Underwriting Risk Predictive Modeling
  • Claims Automation Predictive Modeling
  • Sales/Growth Forecasting, Econometric and Predictive Modeling
  • Data mining applications for Claims and Competitive Analysis
  • Evaluating new statistical methods and tools for potential use by State Farm data scientists
Responsibilities:
What You Can Expect:
  • Logistics:
During Fall Semester, MAGNet interns work 20 hours a week
Duration: Fall Semester (8/18/2021 to 12/8/2021)
Convenient location: Downtown Athens, just a block off UGA's main campus

  • Experience:
Direct experience you can leverage for your future career
An opportunity to learn and network with industry-leading influencers
A learning environment: mentoring and development to help you succeed
A culture that embraces Diversity and Inclusion

Qualifications:
We Are Looking For:
Applicants accepted to or currently enrolled in one of the following graduate programs at UGA:
Statistics
Mathematics
Computer Science
Epidemiology & Biostatistics
Economics

Applicants with experience in:
Statistical modeling and/or data mining
Data analysis and database tools
Computer programming (specifically Python, SAS, or R)
Communicating and presenting technical work

What’s In It For You:
MAGNet is similar to a 50% graduate assistantship offered by the University. Interns receive hourly pay comparable to that offered by the University for graduate assistants as well as full tuition assistance for the duration of the internship. Some State Farm benefits may also apply, including the following:

  • 401k Eligible
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • Paid Time-Off, including specific leave for community service
****Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (e.g. H-1B visa) for this opportunity*****

position: Internship, Digital and Cyberspace Policy, Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description

Overview: All who are selected to participate in CFR’s Blavatnik Internship Program and Robina Franklin Williams Internship Program receive training in the field of foreign policy and international affairs as well as skills training in writing, research, program planning and much more.

CFR’s David Rockefeller Studies Program is one of the country’s largest foreign policy think tanks with a widely respected and influential research staff. The Studies Program aims to advance the discussion of American foreign policy and international affairs through its writing, publications, public outreach, and discussions. The intern will work under the direction of Ira A. Lipman Chair in Emerging Technologies and National Security and Director of the Digital and Cyberspace Policy Program (DCP).

*
CFR internships are paid, require a 14 - 18 hour commitment, and are filled on a rolling basis.*

*
Fall semester internship opportunities are on a fully remote/virtual basis.*
The major responsibilities of this position will include (but are not limited to)::

  • Perform data analysis and collection for the Digital and Cyberspace Policy Program
  • With the direct support and guidance of supervisor, compile and summarize top cyber-related news stories for the Net Politics blog and program website
  • Conducting research as requested by the research associate on state-sponsored cyber attacks for the Cyber Operations Tracker

Qualifications:

  • Undergraduate or graduate student focusing on international relations, national security studies,computer science, or related field
  • Students should have completed the equivalent of four semesters of college coursework (not including AP classes in high school) by the time they begin an internship
  • Previous research experience is a plus
  • Strong research, editing and proofreading skills
  • Proficiency in MS Word, Excel and Outlook

About CFR: Founded in 1921, the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) is a leading nonprofit membership organization, research center, and publisher, with headquarters in New York, an office in Washington, DC, and programs nationwide. It is dedicated to increasing America's understanding of the world and contributing ideas to U.S. foreign policy. CFR's 5,000+ members are leaders in international affairs and foreign policy. CFR also publishes Foreign Affairs, the preeminent magazine on global issues, and provides up-to-date information about the world and U.S. foreign policy on its award-winning website, CFR.org.

CFR’s Internship Program is made possible through the generous support of the Blavatnik Family Foundation, the Robina Foundation, CFR members, and the family and friends of Franklin Williams.

The Council on Foreign Relations is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Quality, diversity, and balance are the key objectives sought by the Council on Foreign Relations in the composition of its workforce.

Full Job Description
The Information Technology and Records Management (ITRM) area of the Human Services and Public Health (HSPH) department of Hennepin County is seeking an intern to join the eForms development team. This position will participate with a scrum team of Adobe developers that develops innovative solutions for use by HSPH department staff and Hennepin County residents. The ITRM area supports, develops, and maintains IT solutions that augment technology provided by the State of Minnesota and the Hennepin County IT Department with a focus on application development.

Location and hours:
Currently, this position is working remotely due to COVID-19. Once working on-site resumes, this position would be located at the Hennepin County Government Center, 300 South 6th Street, Minneapolis, Minnesota 55487. Work hours are Monday through Friday, between the hours of 8 a.m.- 4:30 p.m. This internship will start in July 2021 and will remain for up to 1 year. This intern will work approximately 19/hrs per week during school, with full-time hours available in the summer months.

In this position, you will:
Participate in analysis and design, develop/ create, and modify eforms from specifications that include the following activities: code, test, debug, and document, maintain, and support.
Work on existing eforms to make corrections and enhancements.
Participate in paired programming/collaborative work in multiple development environments (DEV, TEST, and STAGE).
Provide support to development team members.

Need to have:
Current enrollment in a bachelor's program or a recent graduate within the last 6 months, in information technology, computer science or mathematics or a related field.

Nice to Have:
Experience with coding; JavaScript or HTML.
Experience with Java.

About the department:
Human Services delivers a variety of services to individuals or families that assist with basic needs or encourage client change around specific objectives. We work with individuals as well as systems and communities in order to develop policy and advocate for the people we serve. The people we serve and our communities are connected. By helping one, we help the other.

About Hennepin County:
Hennepin is the largest county government organization in Minnesota. Our employees work every day to improve the health, safety and quality of life for our residents and communities. All of our jobs align to one or more of our overarching goals - that Hennepin County residents are healthy, protected and safe, self-reliant, assured due process, and mobile.

Gaining experience on website development

Full Job Description

Yubico’s mission is to create a safer internet for everyone. Our core invention, the YubiKey, a hardware-based token, revolutionized secure logins for top Internet brands, including Google and Facebook, and for millions of users in 160 countries. Collaboration and innovation are at the core of our culture, as we expand to more advanced software and services for encryption and Internet of Things (IoT). We are a multinational, fast-growing company, offering an opportunity to bring your ideas to life with our global team.

Join us for an exciting internship experience in our Palo Alto or Seattle offices with our Strategic Integrations team. As an intern at Yubico, you will have a chance to work alongside a team of solution architects who are passionate about making the Internet safe.

We are looking for interns with an interest in computer security, systems administration and scripting with a passion for researching and learning about new security standards. In this role, you will be part of the team that works closely with our major partners such as Duo, Microsoft, Okta and Ping to build integrated solutions utilizing YubiKeys and other Yubico products. Our team is focused on building integrated end-to-end solutions leveraging YubiKey hardware to enable a range of authentication and authorization experiences across enterprises and the Web. We are raising the usability bar of security while introducing multi-factor and passwordless experiences to strengthen the defenses against account takeovers.

Basic Qualifications

  • Must be accepted to, currently enrolled in, or have recently (within the last year) completed a Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or a related field
  • Enjoy learning and have a passion for security and useability
  • Naturally curious and want to know about how things work.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Interested in security protocols such as OATH and WebAuthn
  • Studying cybersecurity and/or interest in system administration
  • 2 years of experience programming in Python or other scripting languages (through school or self taught)

Full Job Description
  • This position is payrolled via payroll agency.
Group/Role Overview:
The Advanced Data Planning Technology Group at TTCA focuses on next generation patterning process and advanced tooling for use in semiconductor manufacturing. We optimize the processes and hardware used to develop patterning solutions for advanced front, middle, and back end of the line applications. TEL is looking for a data-focused individual who will work with semiconductor fabrication tools, data-collection tools, and the engineers who know their operation. This person will collect, sanitize and synthesize the data coming off the tool. The goals of this position are to find distillations and visualizations of our tool sensor data which assist process engineers in making decisions with an industrial collaborator in ML/NLP interfaces.

Responsibilities:
  • Ensure and maintain connectivity between tools and the data-collection tools to ensure proper gathering of metrics
  • Work closely with cross-functional engineering teams to troubleshoot process/integration problems
  • Help to compile and analyze measured data & developing heuristics for alerting
  • Establishing models for detecting anomalies in the data
  • Using other statistical tools to deliver distilled data and visualization to end-users
  • Working with engineers to develop recommendations and prepare changes, additions, and modifications, which will facilitate equipment operations, uptime and efficiency.
  • Work with process and hardware engineers on demo of on-tool data visualization
Qualifications:
  • An ideal candidate must have or be pursuing MS degree or higher in Computer Science, Data Science or some other analytical discipline
  • Strong technical background in mechanics of materials and mathematics
  • Experience with programming languages (R, Python, C-sharp, etc.)
  • Candidate with project management experience or having previously demonstrated a strong self-directed skill set is preferential
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills a must
  • Ability and desire to work in a multicultural team
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S without sponsorship

position: Network Operations Engineer (1); Team Lead Service Desk (1)--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please.
description:
Full Job Description
Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
