Full Job Description
About Brightcove

Brightcove is a team of smart, passionate people who are revolutionizing the way organizations deliver video. We're hyped up about storytelling, and about helping people connect, share experiences, and view the world. Bottom line: video is the world's most compelling, exciting medium, and Brightcove exists to demonstrate that video means business.

As the industry leader in this space, we empower our customers to deliver top-notch video experiences to audiences on every screen in bold and innovative ways. When video is done right, it can have a powerful and lasting effect. Hearts open. Minds change. Creativity thrives. Since 2004, Brightcove has been supporting customers that are some of the largest media companies, enterprises, events, and non-profit organizations in the world. There are over 600 Brightcovers globally, each of us representing our unique talents and passions and we have built a culture that values individual empowerment, excellence and collaboration. This culture enables us to develop technologies once thought impossible, provide customer support without parallel or excuses, and leverage the expertise and resources of a global infrastructure. We take our video seriously, and we take great pride in doing it as one team.

Team Overview

Brightcove's Research is a team of highly motivated, fast-paced, and highly skilled researchers with expertise in video compression, video processing, and video delivery systems. We develop highly innovative, state of the art technologies for use in future Brightcove products. Our work also results in contributions to relevant standards and industry forums (ISO/IEC/MPEG, JVET, SMPTE, DASH-IF, UHDF, CTA WAVE, etc.), patent applications, and publications in peer-reviewed conferences and journals. We seek candidates with the following qualifications and responsibilities:

Job Responsibilities

Research, design, and implement innovative video pre-processing techniques for improved efficiency of video encoding. These may include noise reduction, film-grain detection, removal and synthesis, perceptual pre-filtering, etc.
Research, design, and implement innovative encoder-level optimization techniques (rate control, optimized quantization, mode decisions, etc.)
Research, design, and implement innovative coding techniques for future video codecs, such as VVC and AI/ML-based compression
Conduct subjective quality assessment tests, and/or automated tests using properly selected objective metrics and a comparison process
Document and present the new algorithms and implementations in various forms, such as standards contributions, publications, technical white papers, patent applications, etc.

Qualifications/Experience

Completed graduate-level coursework towards a Ph.D. or MS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields.
Experience working with OpenCV and other computer-vision libraries and algorithms (face detection, object detection pipelines, structure from motion, CNN-based algorithms, etc.)
Practical experience working with PyTorch, TensorFlow, and other frameworks for the design of deep-learning algorithms
Knowledge of the existing video coding algorithms (H.264, HEVC, VVC, VP8, AV1, etc.) and their fundamental building blocks (transforms, quantizers, ME/MC techniques, in-loop filters, rate control, HRD model, etc.)
Experience working with existing video codec implementations (MPEG & ITU-T test models, x264, x265, SVT-AV1, MainConcept SDKs, etc.)
Experience working with stream analyzers (Elecard StreamEye, Sencore CMA 1280, etc.)
Understanding of color science and color processing as used in modern SDR and HDR systems
Understanding of fundamentals of human vision and models useful for image and video coding (spatial- and temporal contrast sensitivity, masking, saliency models, etc.)
Familiarity with subjective quality assessment methodologies (ITU-R BT.500, BT.710, BT.2022) and experience in conducting subjective tests
Familiarity with the existing objective quality metrics and tools for quality analysis (PSNR, SSIM, 3D-SSIM, SSIMplus, VDP, Tektronix PQA, VideoClarity, etc.)
Experience using MATLAB, Mathematica, or other scientific programming languages and tools
Experience in Python and C/C++ programming and using the related libraries and tools
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Additional/Desirable skills

Expertise in statistical data analysis and machine learning
Expertise in areas of computer vision (detection, tracking, structure from motion, etc.)
Experience in SIMD (SSE, AVX, AVX2) and/or GPU (CUDA, OpenCV) programming
Experience in distributed programming and using cloud platforms (AWS, Goggle Compute, etc.)

Working at Brightcove

As the undisputed global leader in powering premium video for our customers, Brightcove recruits and retains highly qualified and motivated individuals, creating an environment where people can innovate and achieve their best, and we reward them for their performance by giving them the opportunity to share in the company's success. We offer competitive compensation, stock options, 401k matching, and tuition reimbursement, as well as generous PTO - and we expect you to use it!

We offer flexible options to work in our Boston office located in Fort Point harbor, remotely or in a hybrid set up (only exceptions are the roles that MUST work a certain way which we are finalizing soon). Whichever option you choose, we have plenty of opportunities to meet your colleagues around the globe and we also celebrate a variety of personal interests with organized groups and clubs including an Employee Action Committee, Women of Brightcove, Pride of Brightcove, Parents of Brightcove … and more to come!

If you've gotten all the way to the bottom of this description, thank you for your interest in Brightcove! If this role sounds like something that is exciting to you please don't hesitate to apply, even if you don't meet all of our qualifications. We recognize that no candidate is perfect and Brightcove would love to have the chance to get to know you.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Are you ready to join a growing team that puts a premium on productivity and has an award-winning culture, centered around transforming talented employees into effective business leaders?

Then Bankers Healthcare Group is the place for you. We offer innovative financial solutions to licensed and highly-skilled professionals, representing the best of both traditional lending and fintech, and are looking for passionate, impact players to help take our company to the next level.

At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.

With over 19 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

You are a student or recent grad who has a passion for collaboration. You are an analytical thinker that has a strong customer focus. Analyze, interpret and identify key business requirements
Develop and write requirements, acceptance criteria, and prototypes
Co-own features and user stories

Ability to designs technical workflow diagrams and software documentation utilizing relevant toolsets
Translate design requirements to the UI/UX team to produce working prototypes
Identify product limitations and has the ability to propose innovative business and technical solutions
Understands the interaction of different software components
Detail-oriented with excellent writing and communication skills
What You'll Need
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration or another similar field
Demonstrated proficiency in writing and analyzing business processes & procedures documentation
Must possess a highly logical and analytical mindset, must be able to multitask and learn quickly
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills; ability to interpret requests and give quality results in a timely manner
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (experience in MS SQL Server preferred)
An understanding of AGILE/SCRUM Methodology
Project Coordination/Management experience is a must
Life at BHG
At BHG, we work hard and aren’t afraid to take risks. Since the beginning, our core values of PMA (positive mental attitude), team player and loyalty have been the driving force behind every interaction we have between each other and our customers. We have a healthy respect for the daily grind, yet we value work/life balance. We believe that all employees should have the opportunity to lead and that good ideas can come from anyone. From the top-down, our leaders are actively involved not only in strategic oversight and running the business, but also in the wellbeing and growth of all employees. We consider people our #1 asset, and help employees realize their full potential, set and exceed their goals, and explore new opportunities for personal and professional development.

Why You Should Join BHG
We strive to offer amenities, opportunities, events, and programming that support the interests of our teams, while furthering the culture that makes us Great Place to Work® certified. Some of the benefits you can expect when you join BHG include:

  • 100% coverage of monthly health insurance premiums
  • Competitive PTO and vacation policies
  • Company 401(k) plan with employer contributions after one year
  • On-site gym access and memberships, with personal trainers, and certified nutritionists on staff
  • Company-sponsored training and certification opportunities
  • Monthly award ceremonies where top achievers are celebrated and receive additional bonuses
  • Ongoing volunteer opportunities to give back to the community through our BHG Cares program
If you’re ready for a career where you can exercise your passions, be surrounded by co-workers who are relentlessly committed to service, and have a team-player mindset, apply today!

position: Solutions Engineer Intern - San Mateo, CA
description:
Full Job Description
About Verkada
At Verkada, we’re rethinking what it means to be physically safe. Today, we build security cameras that detect action, identify danger and help keep people and places safe and secure. Using a combination of software and hardware, we’re transforming an industry that has seen little innovation for decades—and we already support thousands of customers. But this is just the beginning. We envision a world in which security systems feel as seamless and modern as the organizations they protect and our enterprise solution becomes a model for not just business security, but public security as well.

Verkada is seeking Solutions Engineer Interns, based in San Mateo, CA, to own and enhance the customer experience, from the proof-of-concept to the final decision. This individual will provide technical support to the sales team, become a trusted advisor to customers, assist the sales team in designing security systems and quotes, and create solutions for unique customer challenges. You will join a team of highly motivated people delivering impactful results for the company. We are looking primarily for people who can match our fast pace and learn quickly, but prior experience with video security systems, IoT devices and access control systems is certainly helpful.

Responsibilities:
Work alongside Solutions Engineers to design and deliver technical solutions for our customers and key stakeholders
Collaborate with Engineering and Product teams to test new products and identify bugs
Communicate complex technical matters both verbally and written
Influence product direction with your unique understanding of customer needs
Prepare required project documentation (floorplans, scope of work, assumptions, etc.)
Research and document hybrid cloud security trends in the industry which includes IoT, networking, and cybersecurity

Qualifications:
Third or Fourth year college student working towards a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a related discipline: Networking, Telecommunications, Systems Administration, Information technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Cybersecurity
Strong background in IT fundamentals: Experience with TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, and routing/switching devices; No experience with products related to physical security or cloud-based video necessary: we can teach you
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in order to clearly and efficiently articulate technical matters with customers and partners
Excellent time management, follow-through, and attention to detail
Experience working with APIs, Python, and other coding languages is a plus
Experience working with Linux operating systems preferred
Genuine excitement for software and hardware products and can speak comfortably about how they work
Entrepreneurial and positive attitude with a strong desire to learn
Industry certifications are a plus: AWS, CCNA, MCSE, CEH, Security+, A+, Network+
Must be authorized to work in the U.S (Position does not provide sponsorship)
About our team
Behind the scenes, we’re a team of computer scientists, hardware engineers and experienced founders who saw a chance to make a real impact. We’re united by the challenge of building beautiful products, designed for real people—and by our commitment to using technology responsibly. We believe keeping data private and secure is core to our safety as individuals, businesses and communities and we put great care into building systems that embody our values as people. Likewise, many of Silicon Valley’s top investors believe in us: we’re backed by Sequoia Capital, FirstRound, Meritech and Siemens (Next47).

Verkada is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, and encourage all qualified applicants to apply.

Full Job Description
About Neo4j:
Neo4j is the leader in graph database technology. As the world’s most widely deployed graph database, we help global brands – including Comcast, NASA, UBS and Volvo – to reveal and predict how people, processes and systems are interrelated. Using this relationships-first approach, applications built using Neo4j tackle connected data challenges such as analytics and artificial intelligence, fraud detection, real-time recommendations and knowledge graphs.

Our Vision:
At Neo4j, we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.

As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships. We created, drive and lead the graph database category, and we’re disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.

We are recruiting for Summer/Fall 2021!

Neo4j is looking for a solutions engineer intern with a track record of success to join our solutions team. We’re looking for someone passionate about building enterprise class business solutions, working with sales to demonstrate these solutions to key customers and prospects, conduct proofs-of-concept and evangelize solutions internally and externally. This role requires technology integration, data modelling and full-stack development skills. Hands on proficiency with Java or Javascript and SQL are required. You will be building industry leading solutions leveraging Neo4j graph platform and allied open source / commercial software.

Requirements:
A minimum of 2 years of IT experience as a solutions or data engineer supporting enterprise software solutions
Bachelor's degree in computer science, a related discipline or equivalent work experience.
Experience with SQL, NOSQL databases, full stack Java or Javascipt development and associated frameworks, Integration technologies like JMS / Kafka / Informatica / MQ / Kettle
Ability to work as part of our professional services team on client specific bespoke development projects or do solution demos and proofs-of-concepts
Experience building enterprise class solutions with high performance, scale and operational requirements
Excellent foundation in software best practicesExperience working in AWS or Google Cloud Environment
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills
Must be available beginning Summer/Fall 2021

Bonus Points:
Experience implementing GraphQL based API
Experience on REACT framework
Experience with Hadoop / Spark Experience with Fraud Detection or Recommendation algorithms
Experience implementing Neo4j’s graph platform or another graph database
Vertical industry experience in either financial services, retail, hi-tech manufacturing
Enterprise start-up & software as a service company experience
Country
US
#LI-Remote
Why Join Neo4j?

Neo4j is among the 20 most popular databases in the world and the clear leader in the rapidly emerging Graph Data Platform category. We’re well funded and have an experienced management team focused on how organizations should apply data to solve challenging problems for decades to come. We have customers in every industry across the globe, and we build technology that has a proven product/market fit. Joining our team is an opportunity to define the future of data, analytics and automation.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits, engaging virtual events and a welcoming team. You will love your co-workers!

Neo4j is a privately held company with our U.S. headquarters in San Mateo, California. We have employees located all over the world, from Thailand to Canada, many of whom work remotely, and we have offices in Sweden (Malmo and Stockholm), the UK (London) and Germany (Munich).

More information at www.neo4j.com.

Neo4j Values:
Neo4j is a Silicon Valley company with a Swedish soul. We foster collaboration and each of us is empowered to contribute and put our innovative stamp on projects. We hire candidates who reflect the following Neo4j core values:

We value relationships
We focus on user success
We thrive in a culture that is open and inclusive
We assume positive intent
We welcome intellectually honest discussions
We deliver on our commitments

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Neo4j:
At Neo4j, we value relationships and that involves building an environment where everyone feels like they belong. We believe strong relationships involve being accountable, bringing our whole selves to work, valuing intellectually honest discussions and being receptive to new ideas and perspectives. One of our central goals is to provide an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace for everyone to develop their potential and have a positive, career-defining experience.

Are you intrigued by this role? We encourage you to apply even if you don’t 100% fit the qualifications above.

Neo4j is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. Please read the privacy notice regarding Neo4j's recruitment process to understand how we will handle the personal data that you provide.

Full Job Description
Who We Are:
MicroVision, Inc. (NASDAQ: MVIS), a leader in MEMS based solid state automotive lidar for advanced driver safety (ADAS) and autonomous driving sensor and micro-display technology for augmented reality is the pioneer and creator of PicoP® scanning technology, an ultra-miniature laser projection and sensing solution based on the laser beam scanning methodology. The technology is well suited to support a wide array of applications including interactive projection, robotics, industrial applications, and Augmented and Virtual Reality (AR/VR). MicroVision is an independently recognized leader for its formidable intellectual property portfolio. The company is based in Redmond, Washington.

Is this You:
MicroVision currently has an opportunity in our Test Engineering Team for an Intern Test Engineer. This role requires a balance of both software and hardware strategies to help develop and validate characterization test as well as production calibration and test solutions for automotive lidar applications.

Responsibilities:
Design test cases and write LabVIEW code to verify device calibration software libraries.
Assist experienced test engineers in the development and verification of production test and calibration routines.
Perform statistical data analysis to identify issues and drive improvements.

Required skills:
Highly self-motivated to take ownership of problems and drive solutions.
Hands-on engineering experience in lab courses, extra-curricular activities, or work experience.
Strong programming skill in any language: Python, LabVIEW, C, C++, C#, MATLAB, etc. Experience in LabVIEW and/or Python is preferred.
Some experience with electrical, optical, or mechanical components testing. Experience testing lasers and/or image processing for machine vision is preferred.
Some experience with basic statistical data analysis.

Required Experience:
Completion of sophomore year in an engineering degree program BS or higher; Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Physics or similar.

MicroVision is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. MicroVision is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, status as a disabled veteran or Vietnam-era veteran or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law. Full Job Description
  • This position is payrolled via payroll agency.
Group/Role Overview:
The Advanced Data Planning Technology Group at TTCA focuses on next generation patterning process and advanced tooling for use in semiconductor manufacturing. We optimize the processes and hardware used to develop patterning solutions for advanced front, middle, and back end of the line applications. TEL is looking for a data-focused individual who will work with semiconductor fabrication tools, data-collection tools, and the engineers who know their operation. This person will collect, sanitize and synthesize the data coming off the tool. The goals of this position are to find distillations and visualizations of our tool sensor data which assist process engineers in making decisions with an industrial collaborator in ML/NLP interfaces.

Responsibilities:
  • Ensure and maintain connectivity between tools and the data-collection tools to ensure proper gathering of metrics
  • Work closely with cross-functional engineering teams to troubleshoot process/integration problems
  • Help to compile and analyze measured data & developing heuristics for alerting
  • Establishing models for detecting anomalies in the data
  • Using other statistical tools to deliver distilled data and visualization to end-users
  • Working with engineers to develop recommendations and prepare changes, additions, and modifications, which will facilitate equipment operations, uptime and efficiency.
  • Work with process and hardware engineers on demo of on-tool data visualization
Qualifications:
  • An ideal candidate must have or be pursuing MS degree or higher in Computer Science, Data Science or some other analytical discipline
  • Strong technical background in mechanics of materials and mathematics
  • Experience with programming languages (R, Python, C-sharp, etc.)
  • Candidate with project management experience or having previously demonstrated a strong self-directed skill set is preferential
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills a must
  • Ability and desire to work in a multicultural team
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S without sponsorship

**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist

position: Predictive Science Academic Alliance Program III Student Intern (PSAAP III)
description:
Full Job Description
Company Description

Join us and make YOUR mark on the World!

Are you interested in joining some of the brightest talent in the world to strengthen the United States’ security? Come join Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) where our employees apply their expertise to create solutions for BIG ideas that make our world a better place.

We are committed to a diverse and equitable workforce with an inclusive culture that values and celebrates the diversity of our people, talents, ideas, experiences, and perspectives. This is essential to innovation and creativity for continued success of the Laboratory’s mission.

Job Description

We have multiple openings for graduate level students who are a part of the Predictive Science Academic Alliance Program III (PSAAP III) to perform discipline-focused research needed to help further predictive science enabled by effective extreme scale computing. This internship will run 10-12 consecutive weeks, between April and October, 2021. Our goal is to develop and demonstrate technologies and methodologies to support effective extreme computing in the context of science/engineering applications. You will provide technical and/or research support to projects in the areas of computational science, computer science, numerical methods, mathematics, or other related fields.

In this role you will

Students will work with Scientists and Engineers doing research in assigned area.
Under minimal supervision, will participate in research in assigned area.
Gather and analyze data or information in support of scientific research.
Make an oral or poster presentation on the outcome of their research activities.
Students should expect to spend approximately 40 hours a week working on their research projects or participating in the provided professional development opportunities.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Must be a continuing college or university student in good standing at an accredited institution pursuing a graduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or other related fields.
Must be an active member of the Predictive Science Academic Alliance Program III (PSAAP III).
Demonstrated academic achievement in scientific curriculum.
Experience applying advanced computational science and/or mathematical principles to solve technical problems.
Additional Information

Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?

Included in 2021 Best Places to Work by Glassdoor!
Work for a premier innovative national Laboratory
Comprehensive Benefits Package
Flexible schedules (*depending on project needs)
Collaborative, creative, inclusive, and fun team environment

Learn more about our company, selection process, position types and security clearances by visiting our Career site.

Security Clearance

LLNL is a Department of Energy (DOE) and National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) Laboratory. Some positions will require a DOE L or Q clearance (please reference Security Clearance requirement above). If you are selected and a clearance is required, we will initiate a Federal background investigation to determine if you meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. In addition, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. An L or Q clearance requires U.S. citizenship. For additional information please see DOE Order 472.2.

Equal Employment Opportunity

LLNL is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer that values and hires a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status, age, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please submit a request via our online form.

California Privacy Notice

The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) grants privacy rights to all California residents. The law also entitles job applicants, employees, and non-employee workers to be notified of what personal information LLNL collects and for what purpose. The Employee Privacy Notice can be accessed here.

position: Data Analyst Internship - Emory Rollins Earn & Learn Program
description:
Full Job Description
This is a remote internship program for Emory University Rollins Earn and Learn Students only.

Description of Mission & Target Clients:
IntegrityM has a record of success supporting government agencies and private sector businesses that sustain major government programs, such as Medicare and Medicaid. Clients include the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services, United States Postal Service, Office of Inspector General, state governments, and a variety of private sector government support contractors.
IntegrityM brings the highest standards of excellence and professionalism to every engagement. Integrity isn’t just in our name, it’s in all we do. We work closely with our clients, listening to their specific needs and tailoring services to meet and exceed their expectations. We are focused on driving results, on-time and within budget.
The IntegrityM team includes former government program managers, subject matter experts, clinicians, and highly-qualified technical staff with advanced degrees across a range of disciplines – from economics, law, and public health, to statistics, computer science, and information technology.

Data Analyst Internship Posting Description:
At IntegrityM, our employees are driven by a passion for advancing with balancing quality of life and sustainability. We deliver creative solutions that exceed our goals and foster an environment that creates unlimited opportunities for employees.
We are now seeking Data Analyst Interns to join our team to support data analysis and visualization projects across the organization. During this internship, you will be responsible for modeling complex problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques.

You Will:
Perform study design, data analysis and report preparation
Study preliminary data analysis (trends), literature review, experience and expertise of the team, and mandated projects
Conduct data analysis, including data preparation and presentation of findings is performed in conjunction with other analytics
Create reports of your findings

Specific Data Analysis Projects:
Ad hoc data analysis: Perform feasibility analysis using policy and data to determine if a data analysis study has merit to become a full data analysis project.
GLYDE: Support running and enhancement of IntegrityM’s proprietary GLYDE tool. Must possess strong statistical experience/strength understanding sampling and extrapolation, excellent attention to detail and strong programming skills including use of SAS, R, Python.
Disparate data aggregation : Perform data matching and scoring techniques to make disparate data meaningful.

Public Health Competencies/Projects Potentially Involved:
Covid-19 Data Analysis: Conduct research, policy analysis, data analysis, data mining with regards to various relevant Covid-19 initiatives, including assistance with our internal proprietary tool C.O.D.A.
Fraud Waste and Abuse (FWA) Analysis : Conduct an analysis of the data and provide modeling support for analysis of FWA of medical claims based on publicly available data.
Centers of Medicare & Medicaid Services - Medicare Physician and Other Supplier National Provider Identifier (NPI) Aggregate Report Calendar Years 2015-2017
List of Excluded Individuals and Entities from the Office of Inspector General (OIG)
NPI Registry – used to map NPIs to LEIE fraud list
CMS Limited Data Set Files (LDS): Conduct analysis using CMS LDS files and provide support for potential whitepaper development .
CMS Public Used Files : Conduct analysis using CMS Public Use Files and provide support for potential whitepaper/blog development. CMS has developed a public use file that enables researchers and policymakers to evaluate geographic variation in the utilization and quality of health care services for the Medicare fee-for-service population. The Geographic Variation Public Use File includes demographic, spending, utilization, and quality indicators at the state level (including the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and the Virgin Islands), hospital referral region (HRR) level, and county level.
FEMA Open Data Sets : Conduct analysis on FEMA Open Data Sets and support whitepaper/blog development. FEMA collects vast amounts of data on multiple aspects of emergency management — Disaster Information, Individual Assistance, Public Assistance, Hazard Mitigation, National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP), and Grants. Data sets are available for download, along with an application programming interface (API) that provides data in an easily digestible, machine readable format.

The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) is responsible for administering the Medicare, Medicaid and State Children's Health Insurance Programs, as well as a number of health oversight programs. CMS gathers and formats data to support the agency's operations. Information about Medicare beneficiaries, Medicare claims, Medicare providers, clinical data, and Medicaid eligibility and claims are included. These data are made available to the public, subject to privacy release approvals and the availability of computing resources.
https://www.cms.gov/Research-Statistics-Data-and-Systems/Files-for-Order/LimitedDataSets
https://www.cms.gov/Research-Statistics-Data-and-Systems/Statistics-Trends-and-Reports/Medicare-Geographic-Variation/GV_PUF#: ~:text=The%20Centers%20for%20Medicare%20%26%20Medicaid,fee%2Dfor%2Dservice%20population.
https://www.fema.gov/about/openfema/data-sets

About Us:
Integrity Management Services, Inc. (IntegrityM) is an award winning woman-owned small business specializing in assisting government healthcare organizations prevent and detect fraud and abuse in their programs and ensuring compliance with regulations. Results are achieved through consulting services such as statistical and data analytics, technology solutions, compliance, audit, investigation, medical review and training.
At IntegrityM, we offer a culture of opportunity, recognition, collaboration, and supporting our community. We thrive off of these fundamental elements that make IntegrityM a great place to work. We offer the flexibility our employees need to challenge themselves and focus on advancing their professional development and careers. Large company perks…Small company feel! http://www.integritym.com
Requirements

You Are:
An Emory University Rollins School of Public Health full-time MPH/MSPH student (Epidemiology and/or Biostatistics preferred)
Possess strong statistical skills and able to work hands-on with SAS or other statistical programs (Python or R)
Experience with health care data analysis
Familiar with health related policy research
Possess effective at oral and written communication
Able to work on multiple projects
Motivated & driven to succeed

Integrity Management Services, INC, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, and gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Full Job Description
The JMH Technology Department is looking for a part-time, limited engagement, summer intern focused on the intersection of IT security best practices and the software developed by Premium Parking.

The intern will have to use his coding and problem-solving knowledge to recommend and assist with the implementation of security improvements, both within the software and policy realm. The role will include various technical and creative tasks in support of the Premium Parking software and the JMH Technology department.

Primary Responsibilities

Manage Premium Product security-related project tasks
Audit existing Premium Product software suite for quality assurance and security
Coordinate the Premium Product and Technology Department and other cross-functional stakeholders on special projects
Identify areas of code or design improvements and track resolution
Provide support and guidance to internal and external users of Premium software
Administer/update company solutions knowledge base materials
Support the Technology Department in deploying security-related projects
Review the Technology Department security posture and recommend improvements
Update or create content relating to JMH Corporate security policies and procedures
Assist in the deployment of security software

Basic Requirements

Enrolled or recently graduated from a 4-year college or university with a degree in Computer Science or similarly-related degree program
Two years of modern coding experience
Basic computer hardware and networking competency

Physical Requirements

Sitting, standing for extended periods of time

position: SAP iXp Intern -Marketing Solutions Strategic Audience Segmentation Support Analyst
description:
Full Job Description
What we offer

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

About the SAP Internship Experience Program
The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs, and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

This position is for an analyst role in the Strategic Audience Segmentation Practice within SAP. We are a team that supports SAP Marketing colleagues, other business stakeholders, and our external third-party agencies across the globe. We provide a full-scale service offering related to supporting audience/segmentation requirements within marketing programs and campaigns globally, within regions and individual market units.

What you’ll do:
Position title: SAP Marketing Solutions Intern – Strategic Audience Segmentation Support Analyst

Location: Newtown Square, PA. (or remote as needed)

Expected start date August 9, 2021 – August 12, 2022

In this role, you’ll:
Tasks and Responsibilities:
Area 1: Requirements Management

Work both independently and as part of a team to plan, develop, and implement new audience programs for SAP Marketing and other key business areas
Understand marketing programs, campaigns, and other tactics that are being planned or executed across global and regional teams
Manage requirements and audience programs from end to end, including documentation, design, build, and activation
Meet directly with marketers across the company to discuss audience needs, refine requirements, and recommend audiences to support their programs
Clearly communicate and report on audience programs, how they support marketing objectives, and demonstrate business value

Area 2: Operations

Support the intake request process and subsequent workload
Review and respond to requests as needed for clarification/confirmation
Work directly in SAP’s Adobe Audience Manager (AAM) application for common tasks like data source setup, audience build, and destination integration
Work with Adobe Customer care for tasks that require vendor services
Support troubleshooting and issue resolution with core team members and directly with stakeholders

Area 3: Data Analysis

Be able to understand business needs, formulate questions/hypotheses, and source and analyze data to support testing
Create dashboards, automated reports, and calculated metrics to provide accessible analysis to marketers unfamiliar with audience and segmentation
Understand and use web analytics, segmentation, targeting, and other technology platforms to support SAS services
Develop and share audience insights pre-, in-flight-, and post-activation for optimizations and innovations
Use SAP’s instance of Adobe Analytics, Adobe Audience Manager, and other data and reporting tools for analysis and insights

Area 4: Knowledge Development

Build market awareness and conduct research into audience and segmentation tools and trends
Take available training and self-paced learning offerings to build skills and knowledge in this domain
Recommend areas of new areas of opportunity for audience and segmentation management at SAP

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.
Experience in academia or professionally within digital marketing with a focus on targeting and analytics; media/advertising experience a plus
Working towards a degree in Marketing or Computer Science, or another related degree
Experience with or understanding of digital marketing applications, including audience and segmentation, content management, targeting, and web analytics
Experience with Adobe Marketing solutions a plus, specifically with Adobe Audience Manager and Analytics; experience with Adobe Target preferred
Experience or understanding of digital advertising including Data Management Platforms (DMPs), Digital Supply Platforms (DSP) and other advertising related technologies
An interest in and knowledge of marketing technology and digital marketing tactics and best practices
Strong MS Excel skills for data analysis; additional technologies a plus
Willingness to grow and learn in a highly demanding, fast-paced organization
Excellent written and verbal communication, project management, and organizational skills
Ability to present thoughts and plans in a visually compelling manner, meet or exceed deadlines, and manage multiple demanding projects simultaneously
Ability to think strategically partnered with a “roll up your sleeves” ability to execute

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

SAP DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

We are SAP

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

Our inclusion promise

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

Full Job Description
What You Will Do

The NIE workforce is comprised of Cybersecurity Technical Staff, Computing Systems Tec & Professionals, System Programmers, Solutions Architects, Computer Operator Technicians, IT Managers, Network Professionals, Network Security Professionals, Telecommunications Specialists and undergraduate/graduate students. NIE is seeking graduate level students looking for a challenging paid internship. Each selected candidate will be provided with a mentor and be assigned to a team based on their skills and interests and on the needs of the organization. The division is organized within five groups and provides the following services:

Configuration and Development Services (NIE-CDS) - provides enterprise level configuration management, vulnerability patching and remediation, and system and software development needed for those services.
Infrastructure Services (NIE-IS) - responsible for providing unclassified and classified institutional compute and storage, operating systems (OS) support for Laboratory business systems, institutional network services, and managing the institutional datacenters.
Engineering and Security Services (NIE-ESS) - responsible for the Lab's classified and unclassified institutional network services and for the security of the institutional network infrastructure.
Core Services (NIE-CS) - provides production systems for the division. A primary responsibility of this group is managing infrastructure for LANL’s Enterprise information technology applications.
Telecommunication Services (NIE-TS) - provides telecommunication technologies and services enabling science, programs, and operations at LANL. The group provides the entire Lab with voice, wireless, data, and video communication services.

Essential Job Functions (can perform with or without reasonable accommodation): See guidance at: http://int.lanl.gov/employees/staffing-guidance/hr-process-guide/hiring-process/posting-a-job/requirements.shtml

Work Environment: See guidance at: http://int.lanl.gov/employees/staffing-guidance/hr-process-guide/hiring-process/posting-a-job/requirements.shtml

What You Need

Minimum Job Requirements:
  • Currently enrolled in an accredited graduate degree program in any Information Technology
discipline (or equivalent), to include:
o Administrator (database or computer systems)

o Analyst (information security or computer systems)

o Big Data

o Computer Engineering

o Computer Networking

o Computer Programmer

o Computer Science

o Cyber Security

o Developer (software or web)

o IT Management

o Management Information Systems

o Network Engineer

  • Must be enrolled in at least 6 semester credit hours (or full-time equivalent). Entering graduate students must provide documentation indicating matriculation into a graduate degree program.
  • Must currently have and maintain a cumulative GPA of at least 3.2 on a 4.0 scale (or equivalent).
Desired Skills:
  • Relevant work experience
Note to Applicants:
Along with your resume, please include a detailed cover letter explaining how you meet each of the minimum requirements and any of the desired qualifications.

Location: This position will be part of the Laboratory’s Telework Pilot and may work from a remote/home location within a two-hour ground commute of the Laboratory. The Telework Pilot is in effect from Oct. 1, 2020 through Sept. 30, 2021, but may be shortened or extended at the manager’s discretion. Ability to report on-site is a must for this position.

Where You Will Work

Located in northern New Mexico, Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL) is a multidisciplinary research institution engaged in strategic science on behalf of national security. LANL enhances national security by ensuring the safety and reliability of the U.S. nuclear stockpile, developing technologies to reduce threats from weapons of mass destruction, and solving problems related to energy, environment, infrastructure, health, and global security concerns.

The Network and Infrastructure Engineering (NIE) Division manages the network, telecommunications, collaboration, cyber defenses, and virtual computing infrastructure for the Laboratory. NIE is seeking graduate level students looking for a challenging paid internship for the current academic year and/or summer. Each selected candidate will be provided with a mentor and be assigned to a team based on their skills and interests and on the needs of the organization.

Additional Details

No Clearance: Position does not require a security clearance. Selected candidates will be subject to drug testing and other pre-employment background checks.

New-Employment Drug Test: The Laboratory requires successful applicants to complete a new-employment drug test and maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing.

For general program information refer to the Student Programs web page.

Internal Applicants: Regular appointment employees who have served the required period of continuous service in their current position are eligible to apply for posted jobs throughout the Laboratory. If an employee has not served the required period of continuous service, they may only apply for Laboratory jobs with the documented approval of their Division Leader. Please refer to Policy Policy P701 for applicant eligibility requirements.

Equal Opportunity: Los Alamos National Laboratory is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse and inclusive workforce. All employment practices are based on qualification and merit, without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation or preference, marital status or spousal affiliation, physical or mental disability, medical conditions, pregnancy, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, or citizenship within the limits imposed by federal laws and regulations. The Laboratory is also committed to making our workplace accessible to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodations, upon request, for individuals to participate in the application and hiring process. To request such an accommodation, please send an email to applyhelp@lanl.gov or call 1-505-665-4444 option 1.

Instructions on How to Activate/Create a LANL Jobs Account:

Please enter only your first and last name and current email address (an email with your validation code will be sent to you) to activate the account currently in our system.

Click the Vacancy Name number (in blue) to view any job’s details.
Click Apply or Add to Basket to apply later. Tip : To apply for a job or save your basket, you must have a LANL jobs account.

If you experience any technical issues, please email applyhelp@lanl.gov for assistance.

Full Job Description
If you’re inspired by the possibilities of robotics to change lives and protect our warfighters – join us!

Robotic Research, LLC is currently seeking applications for an internship as an Engineering Intern - Fall - Electrical Engineer. Our Engineers work on state-of-the-art autonomous vehicle systems. We offer a fast-paced environment where engineering comes first, and a breadth and depth of skills, knowledge, and interests are highly valued. You will have ample opportunities to get your hands dirty testing what you design in our specialized robotic engineering and test facility. As an intern you will have the opportunity to work hand-in-hand with our engineers to further your education and contribute to our projects!

Robotic Research has been developing cutting-edge software and hardware for autonomous ground, air, and naval robotic systems since 2002. We specialize in developing solutions for DoD, Automotive, Law Enforcement, and First Responder applications. We have a close-knit team devoted to delivering the best robotics technologies to meet and exceed our customers' needs. Our systems combine advanced control systems, autonomous mobility, perception, and behavior generation software with innovative and sophisticated mechanical and electrical hardware. We have a long history of successful program execution and have hardware and software on some of the highest visibility DoD ground robotics programs.

Building on our past success with deploying robotic systems for both military and commercial applications, we are currently expanding operations and looking for new team members who want to make meaningful contributions in the field of autonomous systems. If you think you would be a good fit for our team, we would love to hear from you.

This position is for a FALL internship. If you are interested in another season please apply to the appropriate job opening on our careers page.

Full Job Description
eCode NJ is looking to hire top talent to teach courses in using real programming languages and professional cutting-edge technology. We're looking for individuals with a passion for learning, a fun personality, professional work habits, and enthusiasm for working with kids ages 7-17.

The pay rate for eCode NJ Instructors is $25 to $30 per hour. Hours are flexible. We expect a minimum commitment of teaching of 10 hours per week and a commitment through the end of Summer of 2021. All positions are W-2 or 1099.

Who are we?

eCode NJ is an online kids’ coding academy and tech camp that teaches participants to create games, apps, and Minecraft mods using real programming languages and professional tools. eCode NJ online classes are self-paced and include live support from a friendly team of engineers. eCode NJ’s camps and classes provide the highest level of kids coding instruction available in the market with a fun, student centered approach and small group attention.

  • Making programming and designing games fun and exciting for classes of up to 15-20 students.

Full Job Description
Ocient is searching for Software Engineers with strong problem-solving skills and a passion for computer science to help build and test the next generation OLAP database system. You will work closely with some of Chicago's most talented software engineers to solve complex problems involving distributed systems, query optimization, metadata storage, web services, and more.

We are offering an internship (Winter 2020, Spring/Summer/Fall 2021) and are located in downtown Chicago.

Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in a BS, MS, or PhD program in computer science, computer engineering, or related technical field

Strong understanding and application of data structures and algorithms

Authorization to legally work in the United States

Ability to speak and write in English fluently

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with systems software development on Linux

Experience with full-stack web development

Experience with high performance, parallel computing

About Ocient:
Ocient is a Chicago-based, venture-funded startup building a SQL compliant, exabyte-scale database platform that achieves better performance than Hadoop and NoSQL systems. It is a distributed system optimized for NVMe drives, RDMA networks and high core count processors and is written in C++. We are led by a management team with seven successful startup exits, including Cleversafe which was one of the largest software startup exits in Chicago's history.

Full Job Description
  • This position is payrolled via payroll agency.
Group/Role Overview:
The Advanced Data Planning Technology Group at TTCA focuses on next generation patterning process and advanced tooling for use in semiconductor manufacturing. We optimize the processes and hardware used to develop patterning solutions for advanced front, middle, and back end of the line applications. TEL is looking for a data-focused individual who will work with semiconductor fabrication tools, data-collection tools, and the engineers who know their operation. This person will collect, sanitize and synthesize the data coming off the tool. The goals of this position are to find distillations and visualizations of our tool sensor data which assist process engineers in making decisions with an industrial collaborator in ML/NLP interfaces.

Responsibilities:
  • Ensure and maintain connectivity between tools and the data-collection tools to ensure proper gathering of metrics
  • Work closely with cross-functional engineering teams to troubleshoot process/integration problems
  • Help to compile and analyze measured data & developing heuristics for alerting
  • Establishing models for detecting anomalies in the data
  • Using other statistical tools to deliver distilled data and visualization to end-users
  • Working with engineers to develop recommendations and prepare changes, additions, and modifications, which will facilitate equipment operations, uptime and efficiency.
  • Work with process and hardware engineers on demo of on-tool data visualization
Qualifications:
  • An ideal candidate must have or be pursuing MS degree or higher in Computer Science, Data Science or some other analytical discipline
  • Strong technical background in mechanics of materials and mathematics
  • Experience with programming languages (R, Python, C-sharp, etc.)
  • Candidate with project management experience or having previously demonstrated a strong self-directed skill set is preferential
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills a must
  • Ability and desire to work in a multicultural team
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S without sponsorship

position: Network Operations Engineer (1); Team Lead Service Desk (1)--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please.
description:
Full Job Description
Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
