position: College to Corporate IT Internship - Risk & Security
description:
Full Job Description
Bring courage and clarity to risk and security

At Vanguard, we’re changing the way the world invests by always doing the right thing for our clients. That means security is more than a priority; it’s fundamental to our purpose. Protecting our investors from risk requires clear goals, big ideas and resolute action. As part of our College to Corporate Internship Program in the Risk and Security track, you’ll build solutions that keep Vanguard safe day in and day out – protecting twenty million investors from ever-evolving threats by staying one step ahead. Make it count.

In this program you will:
Help to drive security strategy for a people-centric organization
Develop your technical skills and business knowledge
Learn by working side by side with industry authorities on high-profile projects and through coaching with our Risk, HR, and IT leadership teams
Gain exposure to the latest thinking on digital ethics, online security, risk analysis, fraud mitigation, system modification and threat detection
Learn not only the technical components of risk and security, but how to effectively communicate risk and security topics to our business partners

What it takes:
In pursuit of a bachelor's or master's degree with a concentration in computer science, computer engineering, IST, IT, CIS, Security Risk Analysis or related technical/engineering discipline required
Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher preferred
Proven leadership skills
Effective analytical, communication skills

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering sponsorship for this position

This position will begin in the summer of 2022 and last approximately 10 weeks.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

position: Data Science Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship - Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Description
At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation. We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development.
We are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America's Best Large Employers in 2021 and for the ninth consecutive year, BASF was named one of the Top 50 Companies for Diversity by DiversityInc, moving up two places from 14 in 2020 to 12 in 2021. BASF was also recognized as a Top Company for Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) for its corporate social responsibility and philanthropic programs, practices and investments. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!
Professional Development Program (PDP) Internship – Data Science Summer 2022 BASF's Data Science Summer Internship is created to provide highly motivated, mobile-minded current university students an opportunity to enhance their professional skills through a variety of diverse learning experiences. Participants will contribute to leading-edge data science projects and will be guided to apply data science skills in a real-world setting. Where the Chemistry Happens… You start as an intern in a leading-edge team with expertise in Data Science, Statistics, and Operations Research - Advanced Business Analytics (ABA). Advanced Business Analytics co-creates and delivers innovative data-driven solutions for better business decisions through mathematical modeling. These solutions are developed and delivered in collaboration with all business and functional units (including Procurement, Production, Supply Chain, Planning & Controlling, Marketing & Sales, and Finance).
Responsible for leveraging mathematics to propel paradigm shifts across the entire company, the Intern will support the initiation, execution, and completion of projects in the areas of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Optimization to increase business profitability and reduce costs.
The Intern will be ‘hands-on’ and work on projects to execute deliverables during all phases of an analytics project, starting from project definition to completion. Deliverables will include the development of the appropriate mathematical models, collaborating with members from other functions to gather and validate the necessary data, and presenting the project results and benefits to key stake holders and internal clients. Also, communicating the ideas and solutions of advanced business analytics to a broad community of non-mathematicians and acting as a driving force in international and interdisciplinary project teams will be a key success-factor.

Program Summary:
As a highly motivated undergraduate student, you will participate in a summer internship program at one of BASF’s North American sites
Utilizing your experience in your area of study, you will help complete various data science projects which will provide the opportunity to further develop both technical and professional skills
Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You… We offer students the opportunity to spend a summer working at a North American BASF site within the U.S. to apply their education and background to challenging assignments that build both technical and professional skills. Our PDP internship is a precursor to our rotational programs, which combine hands-on experience with unparalleled networking and development opportunities designed to accelerate your career at BASF.
Enhanced career development and the opportunity to explore possible career tracks within the company
Development of your expertise and the ability to network at senior levels throughout BASF and establish mentoring relationships that could span across your whole career
The opportunity for consideration of future opportunities within the organization including the Full-time Data Science Professional Development Program To learn more about our programs, please visit www.basf.com/universitycareers .
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent

Formula for Success:
Undergraduate students majoring in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Chemical Engineering, or related field
Authorization to work in the U.S. now and in the future without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
College Juniors preferred (May 2023 - July 2023 grads)
Demonstrated academic achievement (Minimum GPA 3.2)
Commitment to relocate anywhere in the U.S.
Programming experience in R and Python, other languages a plus
Strong analytical skills
Fast learner
Motivated to learn about machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and new technologies
Active participation in extracurricular activities and on-campus organizations
Previous internship/co-op experience is a plus

Full Job Description
  • This position is payrolled via payroll agency.
Group/Role Overview:
The Advanced Data Planning Technology Group at TTCA focuses on next generation patterning process and advanced tooling for use in semiconductor manufacturing. We optimize the processes and hardware used to develop patterning solutions for advanced front, middle, and back end of the line applications. TEL is looking for a data-focused individual who will work with semiconductor fabrication tools, data-collection tools, and the engineers who know their operation. This person will collect, sanitize and synthesize the data coming off the tool. The goals of this position are to find distillations and visualizations of our tool sensor data which assist process engineers in making decisions with an industrial collaborator in ML/NLP interfaces.

Responsibilities:
  • Ensure and maintain connectivity between tools and the data-collection tools to ensure proper gathering of metrics
  • Work closely with cross-functional engineering teams to troubleshoot process/integration problems
  • Help to compile and analyze measured data & developing heuristics for alerting
  • Establishing models for detecting anomalies in the data
  • Using other statistical tools to deliver distilled data and visualization to end-users
  • Working with engineers to develop recommendations and prepare changes, additions, and modifications, which will facilitate equipment operations, uptime and efficiency.
  • Work with process and hardware engineers on demo of on-tool data visualization
Qualifications:
  • An ideal candidate must have or be pursuing MS degree or higher in Computer Science, Data Science or some other analytical discipline
  • Strong technical background in mechanics of materials and mathematics
  • Experience with programming languages (R, Python, C-sharp, etc.)
  • Candidate with project management experience or having previously demonstrated a strong self-directed skill set is preferential
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills a must
  • Ability and desire to work in a multicultural team
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S without sponsorship

position: Network Operations Engineer (1); Team Lead Service Desk (1)--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please.
description:
Full Job Description
Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist

Full Job Description
Los Angeles-based Internet Brands is currently seeking a bright, motivated Project Management Intern to support the development of various web based software projects.

You will work with a team of talented engineers and web professionals who are passionate about the web and where it's going. This is a great opportunity for students or recent graduates to learn the ins and outs of building great web products in a fast-paced, growing company.

The ideal candidate will either have a degree in computer science (or related) or is working towards one. Ideally also looking for candidates with experience building websites or with a solid understanding of how websites work.

Responsibilities:
  • Help to manage software project elements from conception through launch.
  • Participate in iteration planning.
  • Help with requirements gathering.
  • Coordinate with other site teams on projects.
  • Ensure there’s a strong pipeline of work for the engineers.
  • Help break down business requirements into tangible work for the engineers.
  • Ensure projects are implemented according to requirements.
  • Keep the team and other constituents up to date on project status and potential issues.
  • Ensure projects are launched according to published schedules.
  • Help to resolve project, design, or resource issues before they cause schedule delays.
Qualifications:
  • Passion for the web, social media, mobile, etc.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills.
  • Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and follow-through.
  • Must enjoy solving problems using analytical and creative skills.
  • Able to plan work, organize time, and maintain workflow.
  • Able to interact professionally with all levels of staff.
  • Involved with delivering a technical project a plus.
  • HTML, CSS, Adobe creative suite a plus.
  • Programming experience a plus.
About Internet Brands:
Headquartered in El Segundo, Calif., Internet Brands® is a fully integrated online media and software services organization focused on four high-value vertical categories: Health, Automotive, Legal, and Home/Travel. The company's award-winning consumer websites lead their categories and serve more than 250 million monthly visitors, while a full range of web presence offerings has established deep, long-term relationships with SMB and enterprise clients. Internet Brands' powerful, proprietary operating platform provides the flexibility and scalability to fuel the company's continued growth. Internet Brands is a portfolio company of KKR and Temasek. For more information, please visit www.internetbrands.com.

Internet Brands and its wholly-owned affiliates are an equal opportunity employer.

position: College to Corporate IT Internship - Application Development
description:
Full Job Description
Put your technical mind to work

Do you want to work on new technologies? Are you ready to put your classroom experience into action? Vanguard’s College to Corporate Internship Program is an immersive, hands-on experience at one of the world’s leading investment firms. Extensive training, real-world experience, hands-on opportunities and mentorship from professionals will all aid in broadening your technical expertise in Application Development. You’ll receive exposure to a variety of aspects of the software life cycle and positively impact our clients through challenging assignments like LEAN development, UI Design, and cloud computing. Make it count.

In this program you will:
Create high-impact solutions that allow crew to perform at their best and do what’s right for investors
Gain hands-on experience in Agile software development and practice LEAN methodology in a dynamic environment with crew from around the business
Share your insights and make your voice heard in a collaborative and supportive environment
Receive an opportunity to build a network with program managers, alumni, senior leaders and other interns
Participate in developmental activities such as one-on-one feedback sessions, Tips for Success, and Industry Discussions

What it takes

In pursuit of a bachelor's or master's degree with a concentration in computer science, computer engineering, IST, IT, CIS, Security Risk Analysis or related technical/engineering discipline required

Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher preferred

Proven leadership skills

Effective analytical, communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic environment

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering sponsorship for this position

This position will begin in the summer of 2022 and last approximately 10 weeks.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

description:
Full Job Description
at Rivian Automotive
United States, Illinois, Normal

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois.

position: Network Operations Engineer (1); Team Lead Service Desk (1)--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please.
description:
Full Job Description
Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Full Job Description
Company Description

Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.

Job Description

Square's Hardware Team builds the tangible connection to Square. We started with a simple Reader that turns any phone or tablet into a mobile point of sale - and we continue to lead this category with advances in technologies that define point of sale hardware (NFC, display, WiFi, Bluetooth, touch). Our hardware engineers design and develop outstanding hardware products. They understand the subtleties of user interaction, robust communication interfaces, and smart product design.

For this 12-week remote internship, you will:
Become intimately familiar with Square's hardware products and manufacturing processes.
Research technologies for our next-generation hardware products.
As part of the Systems Engineering track, you will develop device characterization plans and measurement-setup prototypes for new technologies.
As part of the Electrical Design Engineering track, you will help design and test electrical systems for new Square hardware products
Work with Square's Devices Software Engineering group to understand embedded test access and APIs.
Write and debug engineering automation software for the lab and the factory.
Reach beyond boundaries to make Square's products better wherever you see the chance

Qualifications

You are:
Pursuing a degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field, graduating between May 2022 and June 2024.
Familiar with Python, MATLAB, or similar programming language
Experience with EE schematics and PCB layout
EE skills including switch mode power supplies, amplifiers, microcontrollers, batteries and charging systems, and high speed digital signals.
Familiar with hardware lab equipment for test, measurement (e.g. oscilloscope, power supply, function generator, spectrum analyzer, DMM), or prototyping (Soldering, Raspberry Pi, Arduino, 3D printing, powertools)
Excited to work on hands-on projects and to make things work in EE or software realms
Eager to apply engineering skills to dig into challenges that are outside of your expertise.
You're collaborative and excited to work as part of a team, ask questions, and share information to solve problems.

Even better:
Experience measurement systems automation.
Knowledgeable of statistics
Familiar with the co-existence of multiple technologies in a unified system.
Experience with Altium Schematic and PCB design tools

Additional Information

At Square, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

Overview:
Modern Technology Solutions, Inc. (MTSI) is seeking a Business Process Automation Intern to join our growing team at our headquarters in Alexandria, VA.

At MTSI, our more than 1,300 co-owners recognize the high demand for specialized professionals within our industry and that you have many options to choose. As an employee owned company where culture matters, we believe that by investing in our people we are investing in our company’s future!

MTSI’s core capabilities are Systems Engineering and Integration, Modeling and Simulation, Test and Evaluation, Acquisition and Program Support, and Mission Assurance services. Our expertise includes ballistic missile defense, air defense, air vehicle survivability, unmanned aircraft, flight test operations, intelligence support, and cyber/space/homeland defense.

Recognized as an "employee comes first" company with over 27 years of consecutive growth we challenge our co-owners to provide the highest level of support and service, and reward them with some of the best benefits in the industry. Day one all new co-workers start with 20 days PTO, 6% 401k match with immediate vesting, semi-annual bonuses, and eligibility to participate in our Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). We offer other employee focused benefits, including up to $10k in tuition reimbursement and an optional zero dollar deductible BCBS health insurance plan.

For additional company information, please visit: www.mtsi-va.com

Full Job Description
Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

About Osmose

With 85 years of experience, Osmose proudly serves the electric utility and telecommunications industries across the U.S., helping enable the delivery of safe, reliable and affordable electricity and communications services to millions of customers nationwide. We are the industry leader in wood and steel structure condition assessment, life-extension and rehabilitation services. Our mission is to accurately inspect and mitigate aging infrastructure in a planned, programmatic manner that minimizes owner costs while maximizing benefits.

Headquartered in Peachtree City, Georgia, with satellite offices in Atlanta, Buffalo, Syracuse and Boston, the Osmose footprint extends throughout the country. Our employees are inspired to perform each and every day by our core values of integrity, customer focus, safety, respect, excellence, flexibility, efficiency and ownership. Preference will be given to student pursuing a bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering, math or computer science with focus on database management.

Generate project dashboards and reports

Promote best practices in data analysis and reporting
Collaborate with cross-functional teams

Previous experience in business intelligence, analysis, or other related field
Knowledge of statistical tools and business reporting
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
Strong attention to detail
Ability to prioritize and multitask
Must be a self-starter with proficiency in MS Excel, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, and the ability to lead presentations with confidence
Candidates with basic programming experience with tools such as MATLAB are preferred

Osmose is an Equal Opportunity employer. EOE M/F/Disabled/Vet

Full Job Description
Agfa HealthCare, is a division of the Agfa-Gevaert Group which is headquartered in Mortsel, Belgium and traded on Euronext Brussels (AGFB).

At Agfa HealthCare, we support healthcare professionals across the globe to transform the delivery of care. Our focus is 100% on providing best-of-suite Imaging IT software solutions that enable secure, effective and sustainable imaging data management.

From product development to implementation, our unified Enterprise Imaging Platform is purpose-built to reduce complexity, improve productivity and deliver clinical value. We use our proven track record as an innovator, our in-depth medical knowledge and our strategic guidance to help healthcare providers achieve their clinical, operational and business strategies.

The Healthcare IT Staging Intern will assist the Staging Engineer in implementing project designs and creation of integrated turn-key IT solutions through Agfa processes, IMS procedures and product guidelines to facilitate the delivery of quality services to the customer or our Agfa regional service teams. Timely completion of customer projects is critical to maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction. In addition, this internship opportunity requires a detailed individual to review technical configuration documents and to complete accurate paperwork to meet all Regulatory and Company compliances.

Main Responsibilities:
Assist the Staging Engineer who is responsible for the following:

Act as a technical Single Point Of Contact and manages the project through all phases of its staging lifecycle including hardware, software, firmware, project design implementation, deployment and ensures sustainability and readiness for customer production usage.
Builds the ordered project hardware into a project solution. Installs and configures all the hardware and software components together on storage, systems and networking level. Applies the required AGFA and 3rd party applications on top.
Install in racks and configure servers from Oracle, HPE, and others, as well as map out, run, and connect all LAN and SAN network cabling and hardware.
Deploys advanced healthcare IT solutions based on standard high availability and site disaster recovery scenarios.
Depending on the desired HW and SW deploys advanced installations and configurations in the Staging Center.
Act as a single point of contact for the project during the staging activities and provides feedback after projects if needed.
Creates and provides hand-over project documentation in the mandatory staging report.

Knowledge and skills:
Knowledge of computer hardware systems and peripherals.
Ability to troubleshoot software and hardware problems.
Ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure.
Ability to work independently and in groups.
Detail oriented.
Communicative.
Mature attitude.
Eager to learn.

Education:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (IT)

Experience:
Familiar with some or all of the following:
Office: Knowledge of MS office applications and related products.
IT-knowledge: Knowledge of IT workflow knowledge.
Technologies: (not limited to the list below)
Microsoft Operating Systems, Linux Operating Systems, VMware, TCPIP, Routing, DNS, PowerShell, SQL, Server and client platforms

We offer a rewarding career in a field that impacts lives, the opportunity to work with a talented and committed team of individuals, training and career development programs, and a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you want to be part of this experience, we'll take you there!

You ‘matter’ to us! Our diverse team at Jefferson Lab includes more than 700 people, including physicists, engineers, computer professionals, technicians and more. From probing the basic building blocks of matter to performing advanced computing and applied research, we are on the leading edge of science and technology. If you are looking for a great job in a unique place where your contributions truly matter, consider Jefferson Lab!

We are currently seeking a Cybersecurity Graduate Student Intern

The Computer Center Technical Student Intern works with the Cybersecurity Group within the CNI Department to assist with operation of the laboratory’s cybersecurity program and the development of solutions to cybersecurity challenges. This includes monitoring, investigations, application evaluations, software development, documentation, audits and other duties as assigned. The Student Intern will also work with other groups within the CNI Department and the IT Division providing operational cybersecurity support.

Applicant must be a full-time graduate student with a GPA of 2.5 or better, majoring in Computer Science or a program with a concentration in Cybersecurity. Proof of full-time status and copies of transcripts are required (unofficial copies are acceptable).

The ideal candidate will possess a working knowledge of the various Microsoft Windows OS versions, any Linux variant, Mac OS X, TCP/IP networking and software development. This candidate must adhere to written and verbal instructions, understand and follow established lab policies, and have excellent communication skills both in writing and in speech. Must have home broadband network access.

The ability to program using C, JAVA, or other language along with the expertise to write moderately complex scripts using Python, Powershell, BASH, or others is extremely important.
In addition, the candidate must be enrolled full time in a local university, available to work 20 hours each week during school sessions (18 hours being the minimum), and 40 hours per week between school sessions.

MUST BE A US CITIZEN

  • Ability to understand, remember, and communicate information and make decisions

At BWX Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: BWXT), we are People Strong, Innovation Driven. Headquartered in Lynchburg, Va., BWXT provides safe and effective nuclear solutions for national security, clean energy, environmental remediation, nuclear medicine and space exploration. With approximately 6,400 employees, BWXT has 12 major operating sites in the U.S. and Canada. We are the sole manufacturer of naval nuclear reactors for U.S. submarines and aircraft carriers. Our company supplies precision manufactured components, services and fuel for the commercial nuclear power industry across four continents. Our joint ventures provide environmental remediation and nuclear operations management at more than a dozen U.S. Department of Energy and NASA facilities. BWXT’s technology is driving advances in medical radioisotope production in North America and microreactors for various defense and space applications. Follow us on Twitter at @BWXTech and learn more at www.bwxt.com.

Mechanical Engineer Intern-TUC01066

Description

BOMBARDIER

At Bombardier, our employees work together to evolve mobility worldwide - one good idea at a time. If you have a good idea, we’ll provide the environment where it will thrive and grow into a great product or customer experience. Your ideas are our fuel.

With an average of over 300 sunny days per year, Bombardier Business Aircraft’s Tucson Service Center is surrounded by stunning mountain ranges and desert landscapes. Celebrating over 40 years of operations in Tucson, Arizona, the service center occupies almost 1 million sq ft of total hangar space and is the largest of Bombardier’s nine aircraft service centers. The facility services both Bombardier commercial and business aircraft. Since its inauguration in 1976, the facility has been located at Tucson International Airport, a strategic location and a key local partner. The 247,000 sq ft Business Aircraft facility is equipped to perform scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, modifications, including interior modifications, avionics installations, customized exterior paint, and Aircraft on Ground (AOG) support for Bombardier Learjet, Challenger and Global aircraft. The Service Center has received certifications from CAAC, FAA, EASA, Argentina (Military), Bermuda, Canada, Cayman Islands, Hong Kong, India, Mexico, Qatar and South Africa.

Bombardier has an exciting opportunity available for a Mechanical Engineer Intern based in Tucson, AZ.

In your role, you will:
  • Assist with interpreting customer specifications, vendor requirements, company/industry standards, FAA/DOT and foreign regulations
  • Assist with determining mechanical equipment, hardware, antenna and system requirements in all types of Bombardier aircraft
  • Assist with investigating design build issues and help develop structural engineering solutions
  • Release temporary engineering to resolve build issues in a timely manner
  • Assist in dispositioning aircraft non-conformances including rework instructions
  • Perform aircraft and engineering drawing investigation and coordination with affected engineering disciplines, Quality assurance and operations manufacturing representatives
  • Coordinate with vendors to resolve installation interface and reliability problems
  • Author engineering to define structural special instructions or restrictions
Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

  • You are currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace, Mechanical or Computer Science Engineering
Please note: Relocation or housing assistance is not available for this position. No visa sponsorship is available for this position,

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by Federal, National, or Local Laws.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.

Full Job Description
Are you ready to join a growing team that puts a premium on productivity and has an award-winning culture, centered around transforming talented employees into effective business leaders?

Then Bankers Healthcare Group is the place for you. We offer innovative financial solutions to licensed and highly-skilled professionals, representing the best of both traditional lending and fintech, and are looking for passionate, impact players to help take our company to the next level.

At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.

With over 19 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

You are a student or recent grad who has a passion for collaboration. You are an analytical thinker that has a strong customer focus. You are accountable for researching, analyzing, and documenting clear and actionable business requirements so that information can distribute them across one or more development teams to deliver the desired functionality incrementally.
What You'll Do
Assists with the definition and direction of complex features and enhancements
Defines and documents stories and conditions of acceptance with other stakeholders' input including Developers and QA
Utilizes exceptional communication skills and collaborates well with onshore and offshore resources
Validates proposed value with customers and prospects using research, prototypes, and designs
Identifies cross-team dependencies when leading a feature through the development process
Helps ensure customers and the organization is ready for new product releases by providing learning content and material and participating in knowledge transfer events as needed
Helps drive features through the development process by working with engineering, prioritizing functional requirements, making appropriate scope tradeoffs, and ensuring completed capability satisfies customers’ needs in a timely manner
Learns customer needs by participating in customer & internal stakeholder meetings
Assists member's services and engineering troubleshooting product escalations
Identifies and proposes process changes including a plan and success measures
What You'll Need
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline
Strong analytical skills to understand business requirements and then break them down into more granular level requirements
Effective communication skills: ability to communicate complex concepts to stakeholders
Self-motivated and willing to do what it takes to get the job done
Positive team player attitude with excellent verbal and written communication skills
High degree of organizational skills
Life at BHG
At BHG, we work hard and aren’t afraid to take risks. Since the beginning, our core values of PMA (positive mental attitude), team player and loyalty have been the driving force behind every interaction we have between each other and our customers. We have a healthy respect for the daily grind, yet we value work/life balance. We believe that all employees should have the opportunity to lead and that good ideas can come from anyone. From the top-down, our leaders are actively involved not only in strategic oversight and running the business, but also in the wellbeing and growth of all employees. We consider people our #1 asset, and help employees realize their full potential, set and exceed their goals, and explore new opportunities for personal and professional development.

Why You Should Join BHG
We strive to offer amenities, opportunities, events, and programming that support the interests of our teams, while furthering the culture that makes us Great Place to Work® certified. Some of the benefits you can expect when you join BHG include:

  • 100% coverage of monthly health insurance premiums
  • Competitive PTO and vacation policies
  • Company 401(k) plan with employer contributions after one year

position: Network Operations Engineer (1); Team Lead Service Desk (1)--Full Time--No Interns/Trainees Please.
description:
Full Job Description
Job #1-Network Operations Engineer
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

Client Profile:
Our company fuels the Global Capital Markets community through the provision of trading technology and analytics solutions. As financial industry experts at the center of markets and technology, we help our clients efficiently scale their business and quickly access markets, supporting them through the full trading lifecycle. We are a Global Company headquartered in New York, with nine offices across the globe.

Purpose of the Role:
The Network Operations Team is responsible for maintaining the operational stability of all aspects of the Client's XXX proprietary electronic trading network, The Client XXX is a cutting edge, multi-vendor, multi-technology network that spans over forty locations globally.

Network Operations provide critical front-line support across many of the Client's XXX infrastructure technology domains, including, but not limited to:

Global and Regional WAN connectivity.
Metro Area Dark Fibre networks.
Ultra Low Latency Trading Fabric.
Edge connectivity to 200+ Financial Markets.
Data Center LAN networks in 40+ locations.
Market Data Feeds.
Bespoke client Trading environments.

Network Operations are a Global Team consisting of regional teams located in London, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo. The team operates a follow-the-sun model that provides dedicated network support 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

This is a client facing role that demands a high standard of customer service and technical support be provided to both our internal and external clients.
Alongside normal daily activities, the role provides the opportunity to participate in project-based initiatives and collaboration with other technology teams.

Responsibilities and duties (include but are not limited to):
  • Diagnose the root cause of operational issues and provide suitable technical solutions for effective resolution.
  • Perform triage, troubleshooting, and fault resolution as part of Client's XXX Incident Management process.
  • Monitor the operational health of the network infrastructure using Event Management Systems and analysis tools.
  • Prepare and implement network changes in accordance with Client's XXX Change Management policy.
  • Work directly with clients to assist with support queries in alignment with Service Level Agreements, SLAs.
  • Identify opportunities within the environment to reduce inefficiencies, increase
operational stability, and enhance security.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation, including: infrastructure diagrams,
procedural run books, and knowledge base pages.
  • Adopt the use of the DevOps tool set to efficiently complete discovery and implementation tasks.
  • Manage client and internal case queues for all incident and project-based work.
  • Participate in Global Team collaboration efforts, including: shift handover, technical peer reviews, and knowledge transfers.
Education, Skills, and Background (including experience requirements):
  • 3 – 5 years of experience working in a large Enterprise or Service Provider environment.
  • Certified to CCNP level, or equivalent level of knowledge and experience.
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage own workload.
  • Experience working within the Financial Industry Highly Preferred.
Required Skills:
  • Solid understanding of IPv4 addressing with the ability to subnet using VLSM.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting the following: o 802.1q VLANs and Trunks.
Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol.
o Etherchannel o Static Routing .
o OSPFv2 o BGPv4
o Routing protocol redistribution o Network Traffic Engineering using routing policies o Access Control Lists o Network Address Translation.
  • Good understanding of the TCP/IP stack and TCP/UDP operation.
  • Ability to diagnose the root cause of networking issues within complex network environments.
  • Ability to create and analyze packet captures to identify network and application issues.
  • Experience supporting Enterprise Firewall Platforms.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting IPSec VPNs.
  • Experience working with Network Management Systems utilizing SNMP & Syslog.
Preferred Skills:
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting PIM Sparse Mode Multicast, Source Specific Multicast, and IGMPv2/v3.
  • Demonstrable understanding and experience supporting Network Time protocols – PTP, NTP, PPS.
  • Experience supporting the following platforms: Arista, Cisco Nexus, Cisco ASA, Fortigate, Palo Alto, Corvil.
  • Experience using Automation Technologies: Python, Ansible, Git.
Working Arrangements:
The working days for this role are Monday to Friday. The role holder will be expected to participate in a monthly shift rotation that consists of working a full-shift on one Saturday and on-call cover for the immediately following Sunday.
This is an office-based position, but occasional travel may be required by the business as part of this role.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Job #2-Team Lead Service Desk
**NO C2C or Visas-Full-Time/Perm Job. **NO Interns/Trainees Please.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead role is responsible for managing the operation of the "Level 1 " team (formerly known as "Service Desk”). This role is pivotal to providing professional and efficient "Level 1 " support. A key responsibility is to ensure that customer requirements are met in terms of communication, prioritization, and escalations.
A strong customer service mindset is crucial to succeeding in this role.
The Lead person will be hands on and will assist with standardizing "Level 1 " procedures and tools as well as making recommendations when discovering any inefficiencies. The Level 1 Service Operations Team are the 1st Point-of-Contact for all clients, providers and vendors service requests, service and maintenance alerts via Client's XXX technical Global Support Hotline, Ticketing System, email, or chat.

The "Level 1 " Team Lead will provide guidance, support, and motivation to the team members.
Oversee the activities of the team, delegate, and coordinate tasks to ensure client satisfaction and establish Level 1 team members objectives, monitor, evaluate performance and accountability in 24x7 Follow-The-Sun model.
Develop a timeline to complete projects and have the team members deliver within those timelines.
Produce and / or review KPIs, train the team members and motivate them to perform at their best.
The ideal candidate would have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance and prior experience leading a "Level 1” Team (or Service Desk).

Responsibilities and duties (include but not limited to):
Manage the day-to-day activities for the team, produce Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), propose/take corrective actions when the KPIs deviate from the expected outcome.
Develop a timeline to complete projects, publish project status updates.
Train the team members, ensure their knowledge is current.
Deliver and help the team deliver an outstanding level of service to our Customer base.
Display integrity and honesty.
Help monitor Client's XXX various monitoring and alerting systems, monitor the Service Operation's email and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Help record all issues using our in-house ticketing system.
Provide and help the team provide first level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application) following simple run books. Provide guidance to the team members on such activities.
Help engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel, so they see the issue through to successful resolution.
Interface with client, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Channel formal communications to clients.
Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution and other Key Performance Indicators.
Foster open communication between team members, peer team members, and managers to bring forward ideas on how they can collectively deliver a more effective service.
In the purpose of the role, work as part of a Global Team that provides 24x7 "Level 1” cover on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills & Background (incl. Education and Experience Requirements):
Computer Science / applicable degree, or equivalent work experience is Preferred.
Understanding of Financial Markets (Equity, Futures, Options) Preferred.
Self-starter with a drive to develop own skills and knowledge.
Basic understanding of Networking.
Have excellent communication, influencing and customer management skills.
Team player.
Attentive to details.

Working Arrangements:
This is an office-based position, though currently remote due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Though travel may be required from time to time, it is not expected to be regular or frequent. The position holder will be expected to work whatever hours are necessary for the performance of this role (recognizing that it involves multiple jurisdictions / geographies including but not limited to EMEA, USA and APAC).

The coverage is "Follow the Sun - 24x7” so the team works in shifts ( "early” shift 7.30am ET to 4.30pm ET and "late” shift is 11 am ET to 8pm ET with 1hr lunch). Also, there is a rotation for Saturday/Sunday coverage.

Best Wishes and Success,
Tony Bruno – Sr. Staffing Specialist
