FleishmanHillard’s St. Louis is seeking qualified candidates for full-time paid Creative intern positions. Interns are an integral part of our teams, giving participants real-life experience and skills that will help them succeed in their communications careers in the future.

FleishmanHillard believes a diverse team brings a wider range of personal and professional experiences and perspectives. We recognize that diversity and inclusion benefit our agency, our clients, and the communities in which we work and live. To that end, we strongly encourage applications from women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

Deadlines for Fall submissions: July 1

The internship is a paid, full-time position requiring a commitment of at least five months (September 1, 2021 – January 14, 2022)

Responsibilities:
ART DIRECTORS / DESIGNERS

Our Art Direction/Design Interns work under the guidance of creative directors with their artistic prowess to fulfil the design needs of clients. Having an eye for aesthetic is vital for success on assigned projects. They show us how they create something from nothing, how they visually bring an idea to life, how their process unfolds, and the results.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year graphic design or advertising degree or related program.
A portfolio demonstrating a strong sense of design and typography.
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite.

COPYWRITERS

Our clients are in need of all types of writing: short form, long form, whatever the kind, it will be written. The Copywriter Intern should capture the voice of the client and tell their story the best way possible. They show us how to change someone’s mind with only words.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year advertising degree or related program.
A portfolio filled with conceptual ideas and smart copy.
Proficient in Microsoft Office.
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

VIDEO EDITORS

Video Editor Interns work with directors and producers, being the tool that winds the story together, demonstrating the ability to jump from project to project, to find the shot that captures the moment, and to separate compelling content from filler.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed final year of a 4-year film, video production, broadcast journalism or related degree program.
A reel and/or work samples demonstrating strong technical proficiency as well as creative and storytelling ability.
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro and related programs.
Proficiency with videography and photography also a plus.

DIGITAL DEVELOPERS

Digital Development Interns get immersed into all aspects of development. They will see projects from front-end to back-end, the creation phase to the testing phase. They find what will work for a program and all its quirks. They are a problem-solver who loves finding that missing piece of the puzzle. The quicker, the better.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed a 4-year computer science or engineering degree
Ability to work in a fast-paced, demand driven environment.
Basic experience with HTML5, XML, Ajax, jQuery and JavaScript.
Strong communication skills, including proficiency in developing technical documentation
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

PROJECT MANAGERS

Project Management Interns work directly with creative directors, account teams, and clients to see campaigns develop from start to finish. They demonstrate leadership qualities but operate best working with others. This position teaches the intern how to manage several tasks at once, oversee projects, and value the importance of being a collaborative leader.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed a 4-year business, marketing, or related degree program.
Ability to work under aggressive deadlines.
Strong leadership, management, communication and analytical skills.
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
Proficient in Microsoft Office.

Qualifications:
Qualified candidates will have at least a 3.2 GPA, previous relevant internship experience(s) and completed their junior year of college, though recent graduates are preferred. All candidates must also exhibit a desire and motivation to learn and the ability to work as part of a team.

Your Application Submission Must Include All of the Following:

Cover letter expressing interest in the internship program
Resume
Portfolio
Letter of recommendation from a former teacher, employer, supervisor, or personal reference (teacher or employer are preferred)
Transcript (can be unofficial)

position: Army CCDC-DAC Data Analysis, Management and Web Development Internship
description:
Full Job Description
Organization
U.S. Department of Defense (DOD)
Reference Code
CCDC-DAC-2021-0001
How to Apply

Description

The Combat Capabilities Development Command (CCDC) Data & Analysis Center (DAC) is offering a Post-Bachelors opportunity at Aberdeen Proving Ground in Aberdeen, Maryland.

What will I be doing?

You will apply mathematical, analytical and computer science principles to develop and improve capabilities for managing data to meet needs of the Data and Analysis Center.

Why should I apply?

Under the guidance of a mentor, you will gain hands-on experience to complement your education and support your academic and professional goals. Along the way, you will engage in activities and research in several areas. These include, but are not limited to:

data assessment
support software, database, and web tool/website development
support conduct of Schedule Risk and performance analyses through various functional areas
apply best practices for quality assurance and quality control
identify opportunities for improvement
support implementation of process improvement

Where will I be located?

Aberdeen Proving Ground, Maryland

What is the appointment length?

The tentative date start for this appointment is July 1, 2021. This date is flexible and is dependent upon the selection of a candidate and start date deemed feasible between the candidate and the mentor. This appointment is a twelve month research appointment, with the possibility to be renewed for additional research periods. Appointments may be extended depending on funding availability, project assignment, program rules, and availability of the participant.

What are the benefits?

You will receive a stipend to be determined by CCDC-DAC. Stipends are typically based on a participant’s academic standing, discipline, experience, and research facility location.

Other benefits may include the following:
Health Insurance Supplement (Participants are eligible to purchase health insurance through ORISE)
Relocation Allowance
Training and Travel Allowance

About CCDC-DAC

The Combat Capabilities Development Command (CCDC) Data & Analysis Center (DAC) is an Army Futures Command organization that conducts a variety of critical analyses to provide state-of-the-art analytical solutions to senior level Army and Department of Defense officials. The Data & Analysis Center's responsive systems analysis supports the "Equipping" and "Sustaining" of weapons and materiel for our Soldiers in the field as well as our Future Army Force. https://www.dac.ccdc.army.mil/home.html.

About ORISE

This program, administered by Oak Ridge Associated Universities (ORAU) through its contract with the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) to manage the Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Education (ORISE), was established through an interagency agreement between DOE and DoD. Participants do not enter into an employee/employer relationship with ORISE, ORAU, DoD or any other office or agency. Instead, you will be affiliated with ORISE for the administration of the appointment through the ORISE appointment letter and Terms of Appointment. Proof of health insurance is required for participation in this program. Health insurance can be obtained through ORISE. For more information, visit the ORISE Research Participation Program at the U.S. Department of Defense.

Qualifications

The qualified candidate will possess a Bachelor’s Degree in mathematics, engineering, statistics, physics, chemistry, computer science, or similar disciplines, with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Degree must have been received within five years of the appointment start date. MediaWiki, and Microsoft applications experience preferred.

Application Requirements

A complete application consists of:
Zintellect Profile
Educational and Employment History
Essay Questions (goals, experiences, and skills relevant to the opportunity)
Resume (PDF)
Transcripts/Academic Records - For this opportunity, an unofficial transcript or copy of the student academic records printed by the applicant or by academic advisors from internal institution systems may be submitted.

If you have questions, send an email to ARMY@orise.orau.gov.
